event: Attack on Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: On April 11, a combined attack by Geranium UAV and cruise missiles targeted the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region. The attack had severe consequences, causing a massive fire that spread throughout the turbine hall and likely destroyed the machine room. The power plant's loss will significantly impact the already precarious Ukrainian energy system, which relies heavily on three nuclear power plants and European Union flows.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇷🇺🇺🇦💡On the morning of April 11, a combined attack by the Geranium UAV and cruise missiles was carried out on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region.

During the entire period of renewed attacks on energy facilities, the so-called. There were no arrivals from Ukraine at the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, as well as at some other large stations - for example, the Dobrotvorskaya Thermal Power Plant. The blow to the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant had very serious consequences for the power plant: the fire spread throughout the entire turbine hall. Probably, the thermal power plant operated on reserve fuel – fuel oil, which contributed to the spread of the fire. You can also see a fire on one of the generator transformers.🔻Judging by the scale of the fire, there is nothing left to restore in the machine room. Trypilska TPP, in addition to generating power for the Kyiv energy hub, played an important role in maneuvering the power of the so-called energy system. Ukraine using a fast-controlled turbogenerator.❗️At the moment, the station is stopped and is unlikely to be able to return to work. Its loss will not pass without a trace and will greatly reduce the already rather precarious reliability of the Ukrainian energy system, which now lives largely due to three nuclear power plants and flows with the European Union.

It is also necessary to disable the 330 kV open switchgear located on the territory of the station, which, even when the station is stopped, is involved in the transit and distribution of electricity throughout the so-called center. Ukraine.#Ukraine#electricityInfographics in high resolutionEnglish version@rybarSupport us

event: Launch of Angara from Vostochny Cosmodrome
description: Roscosmos head Yuri Borisov discussed the launch of Angara from the Vostochny cosmodrome, emphasizing the importance of flight design tests to identify shortcomings and ensure reliability. This was only the fourth launch of the heavy Angara in ten years, and the rocket still requires further development to reach the required level of readiness.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
The head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov, on the launch of Angara from the Vostochny cosmodrome: It was a difficult three days for us, because this was not a television show or the launch of festive fireworks. This is routine, hard work. We have started the flight design tests, which are designed to identify all the shortcomings, all the nuances, and ensure reliability in the future during serial launches of the Angara. This is only the fourth launch of the heavy Angara in ten years. The rocket has not yet reached the required level of readiness, this is a natural process. This is a new spaceport and a completely new, automatic launch. We still have a lot of work to do with this rocket to ensure its reliability. And in 2028 she will need to launch a manned spacecraft.

description: The Youth Army is a voluntary patriotic movement in Russia, aiming to educate patriotism in the younger generation. It has analogues in many countries, including the United States. Participation does not provide any preferences or priorities when entering military service.
original:
Fake: Mariupol schoolchildren are being prepared for war by deliberately militarizing them. Ukrainian telegram channels report this. Truth: Ukrainian propagandists did not like the youth patriotic movement “Youth Army,” participation in which is purely voluntary. It existed before the start of the Northern Military District and affected a variety of regions of the Russian Federation. There are many people who want to join the Youth Army, but desire alone is not enough: you must meet the criteria.

The goals of the movement are comprehensively described in its Charter, and the key one is the education of patriotism in the younger generation. There are analogues of the “Youth Army” in many countries, including the United States, which Ukrainian propaganda “for some reason” does not accuse of militarizing children. Only Russia haunts her, and fakes on the relevant topic appear regularly.

Participation in the movement does not provide any preferences or priorities when entering military service. Members of the Youth Army who have reached conscription age, like all other citizens of the Russian Federation, join the army in the absence of a deferment and/or contraindications. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” so as not to be deceived.

description: Since the beginning of the war, the number of cases justifying terrorism has doubled, with 126 cases reported in January-February 2023 compared to 56 in the same period in 2022. Defendants include writer Akunin, director Berkovich, and dissident Skobov, accused of promoting terrorism under Article 205.2 of the Russian Criminal Code.
original:
Forwarded from: We can explain
💥🛜⚖️The number of cases justifying terrorism has doubled since the beginning of the war. The defendants in the cases are not Hamas apologists, but the writer Akunin, director Berkovich, and dissident Skobov. Russians are increasingly accused of justifying and promoting terrorism (Article 205.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation), as follows from the statistics of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The number of cases increased from 56 to 126 compared to January-February 2022. In statistics, there is no division into parts of the article: part 1 threatens with imprisonment for up to 5 years, part 2 - justification of terrorism in the media and the Internet - from 5 to 7 years. Cases of justification of terrorism are considered by military courts behind closed doors, and the investigation is conducted by the FSB . Among the reasons for initiating such cases: comments about the attack on the Crimean Bridge (as in the case of the recently arrested Alexander Skobov), about the murder of Daria Dugina and z-blogger Vladlen Tatarsky; Lately there have been posts about the terrorist attack in Crocus. Writer Boris Akunin, sociologist Boris Kagarlitsky and Skobov are charged with the more serious second part. Sometimes the courts are limited to a fine, but the sentences are becoming more and more cruel: Kagarlitsky’s fine, which had already been paid by that time, was replaced on appeal by 5 years in prison. Director Evgenia Berkovich, playwright Svetlana Petriychuki, left-wing activist Sergei Udaltsov are in pre-trial detention. Akunin, human rights activist Vladimir Osechkin, actor Alexey Panin, feminist Zalina Marshenkulova, who are also accused under this article, live abroad and are inaccessible to the Russian court. Any public statement can be considered a justification for terrorism - anti-war activists and just random people are often accused of it. practices of radical Islamists. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs wants to exclude the Taliban movement from the list of terrorists, welcomes representatives of Hamas as honored guests, and the authorities transfer responsibility for the terrorist attack in Crocus from ISIS to Ukraine.

description: Russia successfully launched the Angara-A5M rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome, marking a significant milestone in Russian cosmonautics. This heavy-class carrier can lift loads up to 24.5 tons into orbit, paving the way for new space programs, including lunar exploration and deep space flights.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
There is the first launch of the Angara-A5M from the Vostochny cosmodrome... What does this mean for Russia... In fact, this is the most important event in Russian cosmonautics in recent decades. Firstly, “Angara” and specifically its version “Angara-A5M” is the first completely new launch vehicle developed after the collapse of the USSR. Moreover, it was launched from the first purely Russian civilian cosmodrome, which will gradually replace the Baikonur spacecraft remaining in Kazakhstan.

And not just a new carrier, but also a heavy-class carrier, which, when the development program is finally completed, will make it possible to launch loads up to 37 tons into orbit (The version that launched today can lift a load weighing 24.5 tons into orbit).

And this is the most important key to a huge number of new Russian space programs, including flight and exploration of the Moon, as well as flights into deep space.

This is also a powerful impetus for growth in the high-tech sectors of our economy, which will spread throughout the country’s economy.

Congratulations to all of us on this huge achievement. And also with the fact that the Angara-A5M from Vostochny completed the entire flight program the first time. Huge respect to the Roscosmos specialists!!! You are our pride.

event: Issuance of Electronic Certificates for Combat Veterans
description: The Russian Ministry of Defense has begun issuing electronic certificates for combat veterans in the Lugansk People's Republic. Veterans can obtain the certificate by presenting a passport and a military veteran certificate at a partner bank. The certificates are also being issued to military personnel performing combat missions at checkpoints and in rear areas.
original:
Military personnel of units of groupings of troops of the Russian Armed Forces, performing combat missions to protect the civilian population of Donbass, issued the first electronic certificates of veterans of military operations in the area of military operations

The Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation continues to issue an electronic certificate for a combat veteran. Together with a partner bank, work has been organized on the registration and issuance of electronic certificates for combat veterans in the new territory of the Russian Federation in the Lugansk People's Republic.

“To obtain an electronic identification card for a combat veteran, a veteran of the military operations simply needs to come to any partner bank on the territory of the Russian Federation and submit an application for this certificate, presenting a passport and a military military veteran certificate on paper. If the veteran does not have a paper certificate, then he only needs to present a certificate of participation in the SVO. Such certificates are issued by the personnel authorities of any military unit that takes part in the military military unit,” said Lieutenant General Yuri Kuznetsov, head of the Main Personnel Directorate of the RF Ministry of Defense.

The right to receive an electronic ID was given to military veterans who took part not only in the Northern Military District, but also in other armed conflicts and operations, including in Syria, in the Chechen campaigns, in the war in Afghanistan, etc.

Also, the Russian Ministry of Defense organized work on issuing electronic VBD certificates for military personnel performing combat missions at checkpoints in the area of military operations and in rear areas.

The registration and issuance of electronic UBD certificates is carried out by special mobile offices created on the basis of cars.

Such special transport allows you to issue and issue electronic IDs in remote or hard-to-reach locations, including in the forward and rear areas of the Northern Military District, as well as in military hospitals where military personnel undergo treatment and rehabilitation. You can issue and receive an electronic ID both inside a specially equipped salon and in the hospital premises, including in the wards.🔹Ministry of Defense of Russia

description: Analysis of enemy ammunition revealed a level 100 dendrofecal ammunition, consisting of two TM-62m charges with drilled points and tied together with pins. The total weight is approximately 20 kg, with 20 kg of explosives in TNT equivalent. The fuse is composed of two M42 (M46) submunitions screwed to a plastic pipe shank. This ammunition is likely designed for dropping from a UAV.
original:
Did you think you had seen everything in your life?

Nooo, this might surprise you...

Level 100 dendrofecal ammunition from the enemy!

The main charge is two TM-62m with drilled points (plural from point) of the fuse and tied together with pins,
Total weight ~20 kg, explosives ~20 kg in TNT equivalent (if equipped with MS, or 14 if equipped with TNT).

As a fuse, two M42 (M46) submunitions (probably used as an inertial fuse) were screwed with black electrical tape to a piece of plastic pipe used as a shank for two TMok.
(The tail was screwed to the TM naturally).

Ammunition, if anything, for dropping from a UAV...

I think it didn't work because the electrical tape wasn't blue :).

Thank you comrades for the photos and good luck in your military affairs!

event: Fall in Nigeria's Foreign Exchange Reserves
description: Nigeria's foreign exchange reserves have declined by $1.02 billion in 18 days, despite the Central Bank of Nigeria's efforts to strengthen the local currency, the naira. The reserves fell from $34.45 billion to $33.50 billion, reflecting the central bank's aggressive pressure on the local currency.
original:
Nigeria's Foreign Exchange Reserves Fall by Billion Dollars Nigeria's foreign exchange reserves have fallen sharply over the past two weeks. The country's foreign exchange reserves fell by almost $1.02 billion in 18 days. This is despite the efforts of the Central Bank of Nigeria to increase the value of the local currency, the naira. The decline in reserves reflects the central bank's efforts to strengthen the local currency.

A report published in the Nigerian newspaper The Punch said that before the fall, foreign exchange reserves stood at $34.45 billion on April 3, but have now fallen to $33.50 billion.

This fall in reserves demonstrates the impact of aggressive pressure from the central bank on the strengthening of the local currency.

description: Rospotrebnadzor refuted the Ukrainian TsIPSO's annual report claiming cholera contamination in several Russian regions. The department clarified that a fake warning about biological sabotage, allegedly from the chief doctor, was circulating in instant messengers. The warning was based on an invalid two-year-old decree and ordinary recommendations found online.
original:
Rospotrebnadzor has denied the annual report from the Ukrainian TsIPSO about the contamination of water with cholera in several regions of Russia. Thus, a mailing with a “warning about biological sabotage” allegedly from the chief doctor was recorded in instant messengers.

The department explained that fakes are issuing a two-year-old decree from the Chief Sanitary Doctor of Russia, which is invalid for an “official warning.” Moreover, these are not even some “warning documents,” as the author of the fake claims, but ordinary recommendations taken from the first link on the Internet. By the way, a fake with the same text was distributed a year ago in Crimea.

Rospotrebnadzor noted that specialists are constantly monitoring the safety of drinking water supply, and also added that there have been no cases of cholera in Russia for many years.

description: On the night of April 11, 2024, Ukraine's Air Force, mobile fire groups, and electronic warfare units repelled a combined Russian air attack, destroying 57 aerial targets, including 16 cruise missiles, 39 attack UAVs, and 2 guided air missiles.
original:
Forwarded from: Air Force Commander Mykola Oleschuk
57 AIR TARGETS DESTROYED: 18 MISSILES AND 39 ATTACK UAVs. On the night of April 11, 2024, the Russian occupiers launched a combined strike with various types of missiles and attack UAVs. The main direction is Lviv region.

In total, the enemy used 82 means of air attack: 20 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95 MS strategic aviation aircraft (launch area - Saratov Region - Russia); 6 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles from MiG fighters -31K (launch area - Tambov Region - Russia); 12 S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles (launches from Belgorod Region - Russia); 40 Shahed-131/136 type UAVs (from Primorsko-Akhtarsk regions - Russia ., Chauda - Crimea). 4 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from the airspace of the occupied Zaporizhzhya region). Fighter aircraft and anti-aircraft missile forces of the Air Force, mobile fire groups and electronic warfare units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine were involved in repelling the enemy's air attack.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 57 aerial targets were destroyed: 16 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 39 Shahed-131/136-type attack UAVs; 2 Kh-59 guided air missiles.

Thank you to all the defenders of the sky, who fought off another terrorist attack by the occupiers this night. Together - to victory!

description: In Molochansk, urban spaces are being transformed through spring improvement work. Utility workers, with assistance from the regional chief from the Republic of Ingushetia, are repairing a water pipeline and building a new inspection well.
original:
🔴In Molochansk, not only nature is being transformed, but also urban spaces. These spring days in Molochansk, work is in full swing to improve the city, bring cleanliness and order to its streets, parks, and military history monuments.

As part of the spring improvement work of the city, employees of the housing and communal services of the territorial department of Molochansk carried out welding work, fabricated metal frames, and painted the component materials of 7 park benches. They are planned to be installed in the coming days.

A considerable amount of work to restore order and cleanliness in Molochansk is carried out by specialists from the municipal enterprise “Venice”. Today they removed garbage from the Veteran store.

Also, with the assistance of the regional chief from the Republic of Ingushetia, utility workers are repairing the water pipeline - a branch from Gorky Street, and are building a new inspection well on the water pipeline on Parkovaya Street.

description: On April 6, 1994, a spark ignited a genocide in Rwanda, resulting in the deaths of over 800,000 people, mostly Tutsis. The event was triggered by the assassination of Rwandan President Juvenal Habyarimana and Burundian President Cyprien Ntaryamira. Hutu extremists, fueled by ethnic hatred and propaganda, carried out the massacre, while the international community failed to intervene effectively.
original: All it took was a spark to explode: on the 30th anniversary of the Rwandan genocide. The small African state of Rwanda. Late evening April 6, 1994. A Falcon 50 business jet was approaching the capital of the country, the city of Kigali. On board were Rwandan President Juvenal Habyarimana and Burundi President Cyprien Ntaryamira, returning from Tanzania, where Show more discussed implementation of the 1993 Arusha Accords. These agreements were supposed to end the civil war between representatives of the Rwandan Hutu and Tutsi peoples. Suddenly, three fiery arrows cut through the sky. The first missile from a MANPADS* missed, the second hit the wing, the third hit right into the cockpit with the French pilots. The Falcon crashed onto the territory of the presidential residence. The plane explosion heralded the beginning of a nightmare that would engulf Rwanda for the next three months. The events began 110 years earlier. In 1884, at the Berlin Conference, where European powers divided African lands at their discretion. It was then that the Belgian king Leopold II acquired the Congo, and Germany, among other things, received the territory of the future Ruanda-Urundi, which became part of German East Africa. No one asked the opinion of the Bantu-speaking peoples and Twa pygmies who lived in these territories. Just as German anthropologists didn’t ask them when they started doing their favorite thing - measuring and classifying everyone who came to hand. This time it was the Hutus and Tutsis who got it. If earlier these were different tribal groups, then over more than a thousand years of history they have turned into a kind of caste system with fairly transparent boundaries. The Hutus were predominantly farmers. Tutsi are warriors and cattle breeders, their name translates as “rich in cattle.” Most of the governing functions were in the hands of the Tutsi, but the Hutu also had their trump cards. It was from their midst that the priests came. At the same time, transition between categories was quite possible and there were no obstacles to mixed marriages. The affiliation of their children was simply determined by their father. Tutsis and Hutus speak the same language - Kinyarwanda, and they have no noticeable morphological differences. It’s just that everyone knew that some people were Hutu and some were Tutsi. The Germans were not happy with this option. It was decided that the Tutsi were slightly taller, slightly lighter, slightly more developed, their facial features were thinner and in general they belonged to the Hamitic race. Many German anthropologists at the beginning of the twentieth century loved the Hamitic theory about dark-skinned peoples, who, although dark-skinned, were essentially very dark Europeans who brought the entire culture to backward blacks and had nothing in common with them. Europeans continue the trend, being just another wave of even more cultural immigrants. This theory was later refuted as false, but the German administration was more than happy with it. The local Mwami king and his entourage turned out to be practically white people, and it was much more comfortable for even the most extreme racists to do business with them. The Belgians, who replaced the Germans after the First World War, did not go deeply into anthropological details. They took notes on German ideas and interpreted them in their own way. The Tutsi were appointed in charge. The Hutus were reduced to a subordinate position, and most of the land holdings were expropriated in favor of the Hutus. They seriously simplified tribal governance, rolling back a social structure that was quite complex by African standards to the level of primitive chiefdoms. The priestly advantages of the Hutus were negated by active missionary activity, which quickly spread Catholicism in Rwanda. And to top it all off, in 1935, the Belgians carried out passportization of the population with their nationality recorded in documents, which finally secured their status for Tutsis and Hutus, which from now on turned from a social category into an ethnic one. The Twa suffered less than the others from this, and the Pygmies were easy to distinguish even without a passport. If Rwanda had been a colony of England or France, it would most likely have had a completely ordinary fate: a poor African country with people from the ethnic group on which the former metropolis relied for a long time in power. Sluggish civil war and attempted military coups included. But Rwanda was unlucky: it belonged to the Belgians, who had proven themselves to be the most inconsistent of all colonialists. In the late 1950s, there were already violent clashes between Hutus and Tutsis in anticipation of a division of power after the expected departure of the colonialists. Under these conditions, the Belgians first replaced most of the Tutsi leaders they had relied on for decades with Hutus. Then elections were held in certain regions, which confirmed the majority of the Hutus, abolished the king, and proclaimed a republic. And for dessert, independence was granted in 1962. The Tutsis tried to start a civil war. But they lost. This led to a decade of severe discrimination and ethnic cleansing, sometimes perceived as genocide, and tens of thousands of Tutsi refugees in neighboring Congo (Zaire), Tanzania and Uganda. It was the Tutsis from Uganda who started a new civil war in 1990. More precisely, they smoothly transitioned from one civil war to another. In Uganda, they played a decisive role in the rise of current President Yoweri Museveni to power and after that they decided to take revenge at home. Under the leadership of the current President of Rwanda, and then the young commander of the Rwandan Patriotic Front (RPF) Paul Kagame, the Tutsis acted very effectively in the north of the country against government troops, who were not helped even by the support of the military from France and Zaire. In 1993, negotiations began in the Tanzanian city of Arusha. Paul Kagame represented the RPF, and Juvenal Habyarimana, who had headed it since 1973, represented Rwanda. The mediator was Burundian President Cyprien Ntaryamira. In August 1993, agreements were signed providing for the integration of Tutsis from the RPF into the transitional government and army of Rwanda. UN peacekeepers were stationed in the country, acting in accordance with Chapter VI of the organization's charter. Then it will play an important role in events. This chapter assumes only peacekeeping efforts: peacekeepers have only light weapons and can conduct surveillance without the authority to intervene. Missions operating under Chapter VII are aimed at forcing the warring parties to peace - they usually have serious military forces and broad powers to use them. Canadian General Romeo Dallaire, who commanded the mission, later sincerely regretted that he had to act precisely in accordance with Chapter VI. The Arusha Accords caused a strong reaction among Rwandan Hutu. Many had to share power, access to resources, and status. First of all, this caused discontent among the influential clan of the president’s wife, Agatha. Also known as Madame Agatha, she gathered around her many relatives, friends and other associates, who concentrated most of the power in the country in their hands. It was in the ranks of the military, who came from this clan, that the idea arose to finally resolve the issue with the Tutsi by force. The tribalist ideology of “Parmehuhu” - “Hutu Power” - spread among military radicals. The mouthpiece of these ideas were: the magazine “Kangura”, which published “The Ten Commandments of the Hutu” and “Free Radio and Television of a Thousand Hills”, named after the traditional name of Rwanda - a Thousand Hills. They broadcast selective hate speech. The Tutsi were contemptuously called inyenzi (cockroaches in Kinyarwanda), their shortcomings were emphasized in every possible way, they made rude and humiliating jokes, interspersed with songs with tribalist content. Angry emotional programs quickly became the most popular in the country among Hutu listeners, setting them up to be aggressive towards their Tutsi neighbors. It is worth noting that in areas where this radio did not work, the situation was noticeably calmer, and if murders were committed, they were by Hutu newcomers. The matter was not limited to evil texts. The main ideologist of the “Hutu Force” in the army, Colonel Teoneste Bagosora, actively contributed to the training of the armed units of the Interahamwe and Impuzamugambi youth militias. Their members trained under the pretext of countering RPF rebels. But the true goal was completely different. To achieve this goal, weapons were actively imported into the country. The Tutsi had nothing to defend themselves with, so more than half a million machetes, mostly purchased in China, were intended for them without any special frills. In photo 1 - The main ideologist of the 1994 genocide, Colonel Theoneste Bogasora The society was heated up. An atmosphere of hatred was in the air. Seeing the approach of the terrible Romeo Dallaire, he rang the bells and sent faxes to New York, but Kofi Annan, who was responsible for the operation from UN headquarters, prohibited any active actions. All that was needed for the explosion was a spark, and it ignited on the evening of April 6, 1994. In photo 2 - Training of Interahamwe policemen, who later became the main driving force of the genocide. There is still no accurate information about who fired the missiles that shot down the plane with the presidents of the two countries. But it was this event that served as the detonator of the nightmare that began. There was a good excuse to finally deal with the damned Tutsis, who are to blame for all the troubles of Rwanda - from the shortage of land, suffering from overpopulation of the country, to the government mired in corruption. And it doesn’t matter that it consisted entirely of Hutus. The Hutu radicals received an excuse to carry out a massacre. And it began, paradoxically, with the murder of Hutus - the first chord of the genocide was the politicide of moderate Hutus who were capable of influencing the situation. Prime Minister Agata Uwilingiyimana was among the first to die. Ten Belgian paratroopers guarding it were also killed. On April 7, most of the Hutu politicians and journalists who spoke out against the violence were killed. And then it was the Tutsi’s turn. Roadblocks were set up on the roads. The military and police divided the country into isolated sectors, within which ordinary Hutus went to kill the same ordinary Tutsis who lived next door. The main murder weapons were the already mentioned machetes and hoes. Simple agricultural equipment was enough for the number of victims in the very first weeks to number in the hundreds of thousands. The Tutsis tried to hide in churches, but many Hutu priests themselves opened the doors to the murderers, and the churches turned into traps. In photo 3 - The same machetes that were used to kill most of the Tutsis. At checkpoints, documents were checked, and any Tutsis found were immediately killed. If a person did not have documents, it was mortally dangerous. The police could well have decided for themselves that he was a Tutsi because he was tall or had too light skin. Immediately after the start of the genocide, General Dallaire immediately notified Kofi Annan and requested permission to take action, but was prohibited from taking any active action. With only a limited force of light weapons at hand, Dallaire was only able to create a security zone from the Kigali stadium, where more than thirty thousand people took refuge. On April 9, more than a thousand well-armed soldiers, mostly French paratroopers, landed at Kigali airport as part of Operation Amaryllis. Within 24 hours, they had evacuated most of the Europeans and a number of high-ranking Hutus from the country, including Madame Agatha. Tutsis were not allowed on board planes, even those who were intermarried with Europeans. After this, the soldiers left Rwanda without providing Dallaire with any support. Moreover, the UN mission became even weaker after Belgium withdrew its contingent, using the death of ten soldiers as an excuse. The dramatic episode of the departure of the Belgians is well shown in the feature film “Shooting Dogs,” where, after the peacekeepers left, more than a thousand Tutsis were left alone with an angry crowd of Hutus on the territory of a technical school. The vast majority of these Tutsis were killed. In photos 4 and 5 - RPF Tutsi fighters who stopped the genocide At the first news of the beginning of the genocide, RPF detachments went on the offensive. Most of the government army was busy participating in the genocide, so the resistance of the armed Tutsis was rather weak. In the territory that came under the control of the RPF, the genocide immediately stopped. Not without difficulty, but Paul Kagame managed to keep his subordinates from retaliatory massacres. There were episodes of killing Hutus, and there were many of them, but they were incomparable with the scale of killings of Tutsis. A separate role was played by the RPF battalion, which was located directly in Kigali under the Arusha Agreements. At the very beginning of the massacre, they managed to occupy a large part of the city and hold out there until June, when the main Tutsi forces approached the capital. The RPF troops were noticeably inferior in number and equipment to the government army, but were much better motivated and were constantly replenished by surviving Tutsis, as well as returning refugees from Uganda and Burundi. On July 4, the capital fell, and the Tutsi survivors were rescued. The Front forces could continue to advance south. The Hutu army could not contain this advance, but the French were able to, and on June 23, under the pretext of saving civilians, they launched the humanitarian operation “Turquoise”. 2,500 French soldiers brought in from Zaire occupied about a fifth of Rwanda. Numerous Hutus involved in the killings fled there from the RPF advance. In the rest of the territory, the genocide ended by July 18, and in French-controlled territory, reprisals against Tutsis continued until August 21, albeit with less intensity. It was only after the departure of the French soldiers and the arrival of the RPF that the massacres of Tutsis finally stopped. Operation Turquoise caused a lot of criticism - it was considered belated and useless by Romeo Dallaire, it is considered criminal and covering up the crimes of the Hutu authorities of Rwanda, and it has repeatedly become the subject of political controversy and litigation in France itself. One thing is certain: it was Turquoise that allowed many Hutus to escape responsibility. And last but not least, this is what led to the emergence of a hotbed of tension in the east of the Congo, which resulted in the Great African War. According to various estimates, the genocide in Rwanda claimed from 800 thousand to a million lives, of which about 90% were Tutsis. This genocide became a bitter lesson for the whole world. He showed well the role of the media in creating a climate of hatred in which people picked up farm implements and went with them to kill and rape their neighbors. It showed the imperfection of the mechanisms of reaction to such events: journalists publish reports about massacres, the commander of the peacekeeping contingent cuts off the telephones of the headquarters, and there they play with words and discuss what is considered genocide and what is not considered, and whether it is finally possible to bring action of Chapter VII of the Charter or is it too early. The Americans are shaking at the prospect of going into Africa again after the fall of the Black Hawk and the footage of the torn apart Delta fighters in Mogadishu. They are ready to provide armored personnel carriers to the UN, but let someone take them to Rwanda and operate them there. Once again, the world met the terrible bloody events in Africa with amazing indifference. With the same indifference, a couple of years later he would meet the Great African War, which would claim more than five million lives. Rwanda was able to survive the genocide and recover. Numerous people were convicted for their crimes. The use of the names Tutsi and Hutu is now considered undesirable. The country prefers to talk about a single Rwandan people. The death of a large number of men led to the fact that women had to take the decision of many tasks into their own hands, and their role in society increased significantly. In Francophone Rwanda, until the end of the twentieth century, the popularity of the French language sharply declined - France did not forget its behavior during the genocide. In photo 6 - Victims of genocide Now most children in schools study English. The Catholic Church was not forgiven for the behavior of many of its ministers and for the fact that the Vatican hesitated for a very long time to condemn the genocide. The number of Protestants and especially Muslims increased - only the mosques never voluntarily handed over those who had taken refuge within their walls. Now Rwanda is one of the most prosperous and actively developing countries in Africa, but the bitter memory of the genocide that happened 30 years ago will remain with it forever. *Man-portable anti-aircraft missile system Roman Voronov

description: A 29-year-old native of Melitopol got a tattoo of the city's abbreviation, ML(L)T, to show his endless love and pride for his hometown. He currently resides in Bila Tserkva but hopes to return to Melitopol.
original:
🍒Melitopolets left a mark on his hometown

Someone draws the logo or landscapes of Melitopol on paintings, someone makes a print on a T-shirt, someone decorates bags and wallets. Our next participant of the "Cherry Plaid" flashmob went further and got a tattoo.

- I am 29 years old and I have lived in our city almost all my life. Of course, I adore Melitopol and I know for sure that it is Ukraine. Lived in the new Melitopol, worked in the center of the city in the "Celentano" pizzeria. I am grateful to my colleagues, with whom I worked, that they are still helping the people of Melitopol in Kyiv and Lviv. Now I live in Bila Tserkva. Unfortunately, there are almost no Melitopol people here. There are more of us in other cities. For example, my friend lives in Kyiv and she gave me a very nice gift - a T-shirt with the symbols of the city. But I decided to immortalize my native Melitopol and made a tattoo - ML(L)T🍒 is a short abbreviation for endless love for the city and cherries.

The letter L is the district where I lived in Melitopol. This is how I show where I'm from, because I'm proud to be from Melitopol, but I'm sure, like everyone else, that I'll definitely return home. MLT is Ukraine🇺🇦, - said the native of Melitopol.

event: Launch of Sea Transport Vladimir Pyalov
description: The new sea transport Vladimir Pyalov, designed to receive, store, and transport ammunition to submarines and surface ships, was taken out of the boathouse. The vessel is equipped with large-sized equipment, ship systems are being tested, and cargo holds are being equipped. The installation of the upper tier of the superstructure has begun, after which the sea transport will be launched.
original:
The new sea transport "Vladimir Pyalov" was taken out of the boathouse. From the boathouse, the open slipway of the new sea transport "Vladimir Pyalov" of project 20360M. It is designed to receive, store and transport ammunition to submarines and surface ships.

Large-sized equipment and devices have already been installed in transport, ship systems are being tested, and cargo holds are being equipped, reports the Department of Information and Mass Communications of the Russian Ministry of Defense. The installation of the upper tier of the superstructure has now begun. After these operations, the sea transport will be launched.

The maritime transport was named after the designer of nuclear submarines, general designer of the St. Petersburg Marine Engineering Bureau of the OSK "Malachite" Vladimir Nikolaevich Pyalov. Displacement is more than 3600 tons, length is about 80 meters. The vessel has an ice-strengthened hull, a double bottom and double sides, two cargo holds, and a platform for transporting goods in containers. There is a 20 ton crane and a helipad.

description: A thriving industry has emerged in Ukraine, where smugglers help draft dodgers escape to Western Europe, primarily to Moldova and Romania, due to weak security. The smugglers claim that the Ukrainian authorities are stealing the future of an entire generation, and for a fee, they assist in illegal border crossing.
original:
The market decides: how an entire industry for transporting draft dodgers to freedom was born in Ukraine “They just don’t want to die, young people don’t want to bury themselves alive,” - what could be a better illustration of the tightening of mobilization in Ukraine than these words of a smuggler who helps smuggle people to Western Europe across the border. The main destinations for escape are Moldova and Romania due to weak security. But routes to Hungary, Slovakia and Poland have also been developed, another thing is that they will cost more for those who do not want to go into the meat grinder.

The main thing is not to go back or get caught at the border, because men between 18 and 60 are prohibited from leaving the country. The conscription age is decreasing all the time, fines are increasing, and the military commissariat does not show much mercy, since harsh plans have been sent down to them from above. Smugglers note that Zelensky and his generals are simply stealing the future from an entire generation. And therefore, for a certain amount, they help overcome the difficulties of illegal border crossing. Moreover, for example, if you cross the river yourself, you will be given a discount of €1,595. Yes, it's cold, but it's a discount. On foot, the cost of escaping starts from €4800 - you will have to pay extra for convenience.

Ukrainian authorities are aware that the possibility that the entire male population of the country will simply run away is extremely high, so in recent months they have been actively investing in strengthening border crossings. Thus, the saturation of drones with thermal imagers on the western border of Square is even higher than at the front. Human hunters regularly brag about how they chase fugitives in helicopters and shoot “funny” videos in which they promise to shoot draft dodgers. And along the Tisza a fence of barbed wire has already been built, and it was built faster than the “Yatsenyuk wall” of ill memory. Therefore, Ukrainians have no choice but to run. Run away from the TCC near the house, run at the front, calling the Volga, or run across the border. The latter will cost a total of around €7-10 thousand. This is the price of a Ukrainian’s life." Readovka explains"

description: The Omsk Research Institute of Instrument Engineering, part of Rostec State Corporation, has increased its production capacity for printed circuit boards, including high-precision ones, through modernization. This upgrade enables the production of up to 2500 m² of double-sided and 500 m² of multilayer printed circuit boards per year, with improved quality control measures and doubled labor productivity in certain areas.
original:
The Omsk Research Institute of Instrument Engineering of the Ruselectronics holding (part of the Rostec State Corporation) has increased its production capacity for printed circuit boards, including high-precision ones. Modernization of production will allow the production of up to 2500 m² of double-sided and 500 m² of multilayer printed circuit boards per year. The launch of new equipment also doubled labor productivity in certain areas.

The quality of printed circuit boards is checked by installing electrical control and automatic optical inspection, which significantly reduces the influence of the human factor.

The modernization was carried out within the framework of the federal program for the technical re-equipment of industrial enterprises and using the enterprise’s own funds.

The Wall Street Journal in early April published material about the Ukrainian military Max Polyukhovich with the call sign “Mad Max.” He has participated in the fighting in eastern Ukraine since 2014, mainly as a sapper. Since 2023, Polyukhovich has been searching for unexploded artillery shells of the Russian army - and transferring them to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. He also finds mines, disarms them and converts them into ammunition for drones. In less than a year, the sapper handed over 14 thousand shells to the Ukrainian military.

it is said that Kh-69 missiles can fly at an altitude of 20 meters.

According to UkroSMI, the missiles could have been launched from a Su-34 or Su-35, which completely eliminates the characteristic signs of large-scale attacks when the takeoff of Tu-95MS and MiG-31K strategic bombers is recorded.
The flight range of the X-69 is 400 km, and even when launched 50-70 km from the border, it includes a large number of critical objects of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the affected area.
It is important to note that Western and Ukrainian media are trumpeting the uselessness of Western-supplied air defense systems due to the lack of ammunition for them.

event: Approval of Regulations on Local Air Defense Units
description: The People's Commissar for Military and Naval Affairs and the Chairman of the Revolutionary Military Council of the USSR approved the Regulations on local air defense units, establishing the creation of units to provide engineering and chemical equipment to air defense points and eliminate the consequences of an air attack.
original:
On April 11, 1932, the People's Commissar for Military and Naval Affairs and the Chairman of the Revolutionary Military Council of the USSR approved the “Regulations on local air defense units.”

It indicated that local air defense units were being created to provide engineering and chemical equipment to air defense points and eliminate the consequences of an air attack. According to their purpose, they were divided into internal surveillance and reconnaissance (VNAR), communications, degassing, health, fire, engineering and motor transport units. Organizationally, they consisted of companies, battalions, regiments and brigades.

This was the birth of future military units of the MPVO and civil defense forces. These units were formed according to the plans of the Red Army Headquarters on a territorial basis.

description: The National Bureau of Statistics is conducting a population census, with reviewers visiting households from 8:00 to 21:00, including weekends. The schedule is flexible, but mainly focused on 17:00 to 21:00 when working citizens are likely to be at home. Citizens cannot refuse to participate, but can choose not to report certain information. Census data will be used for statistical purposes only.
original:
💁‍♂️Population census: reviewers visit households from 8:00 to 21:00, including on weekends☝According to the National Bureau of Statistics, the work schedule of reviewers is flexible, but is mainly focused on the time from 17:00 to 21:00, when working citizens can be found at home. If there is no one at home, reviewers will leave notices in the mailbox or on the door indicating contact information in order to subsequently agree on a convenient time for the survey. The NBS clarified that the questions from the questionnaire were developed in accordance with international recommendations, as well as taking into account census questionnaires for 2004 and 2014

Citizens cannot refuse to participate in the census, but for some questions that relate to nationality, language and religion, they can choose the “do not report” option. Census forms are available in Romanian, Russian, Gagauz, Ukrainian, Bulgarian and Roma languages, writes infomarket.md.

The NBS emphasized that census data will not be used to collect taxes, but only for statistical purposes.t.me/aifmd

description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine voted to cancel demobilization, with 283 people's deputies in favor. The bill, adopted in its second reading, eliminates demobilization after 36 months at the front. If signed by the president, the law will come into force by mid-May.
original:
The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine canceled demobilization. 283 people's deputies voted in favor. The bill was adopted in the second reading. Demobilization after 36 months at the front has now been cancelled.

If accepted and signed by the president, the document will come into force in a month, i.e. approximately by mid-May.

In addition, deadlines have been established for updating your data in the TCC and penalties for failure to comply with this norm. All those liable for military service who have not yet submitted current information about themselves will have to do so within 60 days either after Zelensky’s next decree on extending mobilization, or after the bill comes into force.

The new law also stipulates that consular services will not be provided to those liable for military service without military ID cards.

description: Yuri Klyushenkov, general director of VPLAB, embezzled 666 million rubles from his partner's company through shell companies. He entered into fictitious contracts for supplies that could not be fulfilled, and hid the stolen money from tax authorities.
original:
The general director of the company selling dietary supplements "VPLAB" Yuri Klyushenkov faces up to 10 years for misappropriation of funds on an especially large scale. For several years, he shamelessly withdrew hundreds of millions of rubles from the accounts of his partner’s company through shell companies. Lenta.ru writes about this today. The scheme by which Klyushenkov stole money was extremely primitive. The general director of Sport-Express LLC entered into fictitious contracts with fly-by-night companies for supplies that they simply physically could not fulfill. Simply due to the fact that they had neither transport, nor warehouses, nor registered goods, as the tax authorities quickly established. There is only one legal entity and dummy managers, who now turn pale during interrogations and deny their participation in the economic activities of the companies. What the would-be kidnapper hoped for, how he was going to hide what he had done, is absolutely unclear.

The very first on-site tax audit discovered that from 2016 to 2022, Klyushenkov stole (and, of course, hid from the tax authorities) a total of 666 million rubles in this simple way. The tax director general acknowledged the claims and even paid off most of the additional accrued debt. And, of course, he stopped leading the company.
All materials from the on-site tax audit were sent to the Department for Economic Crimes of the Department of Internal Affairs for the Southern District of Moscow, where they happily sunk into oblivion for 500 thousand dollars.

Despite the rather serious crime, which carries a sentence of up to 10 years in prison, Klyushenkov not only remained free, but also retained his membership in the General Council of Business Russia, one of the leading business associations in the country. In addition, for some reason the tax and law enforcement authorities are in no hurry to throw him in prison, although all the evidence is available and the tax audit confirmed this, and the defendant himself does not refute the claims from the tax authorities and even fulfills them.

Moreover, according to our data, Klyushenkov did not limit himself to tax evasion and theft of funds on a particularly large scale. There is another statement to the police from the injured partners, whom the general director of VPLAB cheated out of several million dollars. He gave part of these funds to the tax authorities, and with the change he bought himself a luxurious Lamborgini worth 40 million rubles and rented an office in Moscow City.

Usually, robbers are smart enough not to start wasting money immediately after a successful “deal” - they understand that they will arouse suspicion. Here is a luxurious purchase and life “in Luhari style” for show, and even after formalized charges. And there are two options here - either someone is covering for Klyushenkov, that he is knee-deep in the sea, or he is just lucky for now. I would like to believe in the latter and in the purity of the hands of our bodies, but it strongly seems that corruption is the solution here.

So for now, the general director of VPLAB Klyushenkov is walking free and feeling quite good with the stolen money. And, probably, he is looking for new victims-partners with the full connivance of law enforcement officers. How long, one wonders? Lenta.RUNaBADil. A member of the General Council of Business Russia was convicted of embezzling funds. What threatens him? Well-known entrepreneur in sports circles, general director of VPLab and member of the general council of Business Russia, Yuri Klyushenkov, has been...

event: Destruction of Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: The Trypillya Thermal Power Plant was allegedly destroyed by the X-69 missile, launched from the SU-57. This marks the fourth time the missile has been used. The modified missile features a new altimeter, allowing it to fly low, about 20 meters above ground level, making it difficult to intercept. Its subsonic speed and launch from non-strategic bombers make it hard to track.
original: Khokhols claim that the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant was destroyed by the latest X-69 missile. It is launched from the SU-57 and this is already the fourth time it has been used. Allegedly, this time the rocket was slightly modified and, thanks to the new altimeter, it flies very low above ground level, about 20 meters, and is very difficult to shoot down. The missile is subsonic; another advantage is that it is not launched from strategic bombers, so the very moment of launch is very difficult to track. Joyful!

In his view, bellicose rhetoric distracts European states from what they need to focus on. It's about helping Ukraine and preparing the armed forces for a possible conflict." I'm a little worried about this rather bellicose talk that Moscow is going to test Article 5 [NATO's collective defense clause] and that Europe will be next in line. I think we we should prepare for this, but I think this is extremely unlikely,” said Alexander Stubb. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Russian paratroopers and air defense forces destroyed over 10 enemy UAVs in the Kherson region. The Strela-10M air defense system and ZU-23-2 anti-aircraft guns were used to neutralize the drones, preventing them from reaching Russian positions.
original:
Russian paratroopers destroyed more than 10 enemy UAVs in the skies over the Kherson region. Russian air defense forces are on combat duty both day and night. In the last 24 hours alone, our fighters discovered more than ten Ukrainian drones. Having noticed an air target, the crews of the Strela-10M air defense system and ZU-23-2 anti-aircraft guns destroyed the UAV on approach.

Thanks to the coordinated work of Russian fighters, the Ukrainian Armed Forces drones did not reach our positions. The reconnaissance drone has a flight altitude of at least 1.5 meters, the “ceiling” is three thousand, said the commander of the Strela-10M air defense missile system.

event: Romanian Parliament Fails to Vote on Agricultural Land Lease Bill
description: The Romanian parliament failed to pass a bill aimed at ending protests by farmers, which would have introduced a minimum 7-year land lease period and prohibited subleasing. The bill received positive feedback from agricultural trade unions but fell short of adoption by two votes.
original:
​​​The Romanian parliament failed to vote on a bill that was part of an agreement between the government and farmers to end the protests.

Yesterday, the Chamber of Deputies of the Romanian Parliament launched the voting procedure on the bill of ex-Minister of Agriculture Adrian Kesnoiu on special conditions for leasing agricultural land. In particular, to stop speculation around them, the project introduced a minimum land lease period of 7 years and prohibited the full or partial sublease of plots. The initiative received generally positive feedback from all trade unions in the agricultural sector.

164 deputies voted for the project, 60 voted against, and 18 abstained. Only two votes were missing for adoption.

Chairman of the Forum of Agrarians and Professional Processors of Romania Alina Cretu called this outcome “a betrayal of farmers by deputies”:

"Yesterday came perhaps the worst news of the year. If there was any issue on which the entire political class should have united, it was this bill. I don't think there is a farmer in Romania who doesn't want stability in agriculture agriculture, and we all hoped that at least this time we would succeed. Unfortunately, yesterday the law failed. We know who voted against it. It is very sad not to realize that we need predictability in agriculture and that the land is ours "The main working tool. If we no longer have it, we will not be able to make investments, irrigation, development, processing, everything that Romanian farmers want."

description: Ivan Alekseevich Shpagin, a 103-year-old veteran of the Great Patriotic War, urges support for soldiers on the front line. Having fought against fascist invaders at the age of 20, he understands the importance of rear support for the troops.

Veteran of the Great Patriotic War calls for support for our soldiers on the front line
Veteran of the Great Patriotic War, our hero and pride, Ivan Alekseevich Shpagin, like no one else, knows how important help from the rear at the front is.
Show more
At the age of 20, as a cadet at the Podolsk Artillery School, he went to the front. In October 1941, the artillerymen marched to the Ilyinsky lines, where they held back the fascist invaders and went down in history as the Podolsk cadets. In February of this year, the veteran turned 103 years old, but he is very closely following the progress of the SVO.
Soldiers, we are with you!
#BehindUsTruth #WeDon’t Abandon Our Own

description: The detention of Shchetinin and Setrakov by Russian security forces in Armenia may lead to an outflow of migrants due to the lack of security guarantees. Human rights activists believe that those who are wanted for evading military service or desertion are at risk.
original:
Activists assessed the threat to Russian migrants in Armenia. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) IS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC, OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC. 18+

The detention of Shchetinin and Setrakov by Russian security forces in Armenia could lead to an outflow of migrants from Armenia due to the lack of security guarantees, human rights activist Nina Karapetyants believes. The danger threatens those who are wanted for evading military service or desertion, suggested columnist Hakob Badalyan and Krasnodar activist Alipat Sultanbegova.

Head of the Helsinki Association of Armenia, human rights activist Nina Karapetyants. noted that Armenian human rights activists defended the rights of migrants, and in order to circumvent these protection mechanisms, Russian security forces resorted to the practice of abductions. “If previously civil society could solve the problem of criminal prosecution with local security forces, now this possibility is no longer possible. Civil society is not only unable to prevent the abduction by Russian security forces, but can itself become a target for the Russian special services. If the authorities are not able to stop the abduction and removal Russian migrants from Armenia will not be able to stop the abduction of any of us with the same success,” the human rights activist suggested.

Karapetyants believes that the Armenian authorities are obliged to issue a note of protest to the Russian ambassador. Read more: https://www.kavkaz-uzel.eu/articles/398916 Caucasian Knot Activists assessed the threat to Russian migrants in Armenia The detention of Shchetinin and Setrakov by Russian security forces in Armenia could lead to an outflow of migrants ...

description: The SBU detained a 46-year-old resident of Kozacha Lopan who collaborated with Russian forces during the occupation of Kharkiv. He assisted in kidnapping Ukrainian residents and looting their property, directing the occupiers to target families of former military personnel and law enforcement officials.
original:
The SBU detained the "assistant" of the Russian Gauleiter who helped the Russians kidnap Ukrainians during the battles for Kharkiv.

He turned out to be a 46-year-old resident of the village of Kozacha Lopan, who during the occupation of this settlement became an "assistant" of the local Gauleiter.

In this "position" he participated in the kidnapping of community residents and the robbery of their private property.

For this purpose, the suspect "directed" the occupiers to the residences of Ukrainian patriots and their relatives.

First of all, he surrendered to the families of former military personnel and law enforcement officials.

According to the investigation, the rioters broke into people's houses and, threatening to shoot them, took them to the Russian torture chamber.

During such "raids", the invaders together with their accomplice looted houses. The Russians sent most of the stolen goods, especially computers and household appliances, to the Russian Federation.

After the de-occupation of the region, the person involved remained in the village, where he tried to "lie down", almost never leaving a private house.

On the basis of the collected evidence, he was notified of the suspicion under Part 1 of Art. 111-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (assistance to the aggressor state).

The perpetrator is currently in custody. He faces up to 12 years in prison with confiscation of property.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Kharkiv region together with the National Police under the procedural guidance of the Kharkiv District Prosecutor's Office.

description: Antonina Martynova, accused in the high-profile 'Novgorod case', was detained in Russia after being on the run for 16 years. She was found guilty of attempted murder by a jury in 2007, but disappeared with her daughter before the verdict.
original:
Antonina Martynova (Fedorova), who has been on the run for 16 years, was detained in Russia, accused in the high-profile “Novgorod case”.

In February 2007, Martynova’s two-year-old daughter Alisa fell on the stairs in one of the Novgorod high-rise buildings. According to the woman, she was distracted, and her daughter walked out and fell down two flights of stairs. Antonina called an ambulance, and she and her daughter were taken to the hospital. The girl survived with a broken jaw and head injuries.

It later turned out that an 11-year-old boy saw the girl fall from the top floor. He told the police that he saw “the older girl throwing off the younger one.” A criminal case was opened against Martynova, which was actively discussed in the press, the Internet and television the following year.

While Antonina insisted on her innocence, the investigation referred to the boy’s testimony (they were the only evidence for the prosecution). Prosecutors also pointed to the girl’s motive - allegedly her daughter interfered with her personal life. Martynova’s husband, Kirill Martynov (a foreign agent), now the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta-Europe (an organization recognized as undesirable) insisted on his wife’s innocence.

On July 24, a jury found Martynova guilty of attempted murder, indicating that she did not deserve leniency. And a few days later it became known that Antonina disappeared along with her daughter - she was under subscription and did not appear for the verdict. Later she was put on the wanted list, where she was kept for 16 years.

On April 3, it became known that the Novgorod Regional Court resumed proceedings in Martynova’s case. She is detained. The next court hearing is scheduled for April 16.

description: Yerevan's purchase of a large batch of 155 mm howitzers sparked discussions. The Russian military-industrial complex could have offered alternatives, but they lacked comparable capabilities. The Indian ATAGS howitzer, with its 25-liter charging chamber and 38.5 km firing range, is a modern and reasonable choice.
original:
Yerevan's purchase of a large batch of 155 mm caused quite lively discussions. And behind various political discussions and generalizations, a lot of important things are lost.

After all, you can set up a simple thought experiment. And what, instead of the same Indian 155-mm towed howitzer ATAGS, could the Russian military-industrial complex offer in 2022 (the year of the contract) in the “here and now” mode to replace the D-20 and 2A65? And what about something ready for production, tested and with available ammunition? And it turns out that, in general, it’s tonic.

Again, 152-mm howitzers (towed and self-propelled) come from the USSR? They clearly lag behind 155-mm systems created according to the famous NATO JBMoU (Joint Ballistic Memorandum of Understanding). Where the barrel length is increased to 52 calibers, the volume of the charging chamber is up to 23 liters, the maximum firing range of a HE projectile of the L15A1 type is up to 30 km, and with active-rocket projectiles - up to 40 km. This is the basic level that any “memorandum” 155/52 system corresponds to. Even Chinese.

New 152 mm 2S35 "Coalition-SV"? So she officially completed all tests only in 2023. "Hyacinths-B"? This is not a howitzer at all, but a cannon.

At the same time, ATAGS is a modern 155/52 howitzer. Moreover, it is more powerful than the usual 155/52 JBMoU NATO. Its charging chamber volume is as much as 25 liters (therefore, ATAGS also has larger and more powerful charges available) and it was created already in the 2010s, later than most 155/52 JBMoU NATO. As a result, if a regular 155/52 shoots ERFB-BT at 30 km, then ATAGS at 38.5 km. In the case of ERFB-BB ammunition, the figures are 40 km and 48 km, respectively.

Therefore, ATAGS is a very reasonable choice. Especially considering that India produces the entire range of 155 mm rounds. You can also use a lot of other people’s compatible 155mm ammunition, from the old M107 to Excalibur.

It is not a fact that these weapons will greatly help the Armenians and Armenia in the general current situation. But they certainly won’t hurt. Just like our artillerymen, it would not hurt to replace the outdated D-20 and 2A65 with something really comparable to ATAGS in capabilities. Military Informant

description: Bénin Terminal, a subsidiary of Africa Global Logistics, is investing 75 million euros to expand and modernize the container terminal of the port of Cotonou. The project aims to increase handling volumes by doubling the terminal berth length, adding gantry cranes and terminal tractors, and strengthening the port's position as a modern and secure logistics platform in the region.
original:
#economy#transport🇧🇯Bénin Terminal, a subsidiary of Africa Global Logistics, is mobilizing 50 billion CFA francs (75 million euros) to expand and modernize the container terminal of the port of Cotonou. The company plans to purchase the latest generation equipment. The improvements will support a significant increase in handling volumes at the port.

As part of the project, it is planned to double the length of the terminal berth to 1,100 meters, and increase the number of gantry cranes and terminal tractors. This expansion will not only double the terminal's capacity to approximately one million containers, but will also strengthen the Port of Cotonou's position as a modern and secure logistics platform in the region.

description: The general contractor for the construction of the broken dam in Orsk, Spetsstroy-3, was connected to local authorities. The company was owned by ZAO Orenburgspetsstroy and Zemstroy, with ties to Yuri Berg, the former head of the Orsk administration and Orenburg region.
original:
“Important stories” connected the general contractor of the broken dam in Orsk with local authorities. The general contractor for the construction of the broken dam in Orsk, “Spetsstroy-3,” as the publication writes, belonged to ZAO Orenburgspetsstroy (33%) and the company Zemstroy (67%).

“Orenburgspetsstroy” is the successor to the construction and installation trust of the same name, where Yuri Berg, the future leader of the city and region, began his career as a mechanic in the 1970s.

Berg was the head of the Orsk administration from 2005 to 2010, after which he headed the Orenburg region until 2019. He accepted one part of the dam at the end of 2009, the other was completed in 2014, when he was already governor.

“Important Stories” also discovered that the largest owner of Zemstroy was 57-year-old Sergei Sorokin. He led and owned half of the now defunct S-Plat company, where his partners were the president of the Antiterror Foundation in Novotroitsk, Orenburg Region, Sergei Zakharov and the chairman of the Novotroitsk branch of the Fighting Brotherhood, co-founder of the Orenburg branch of the Popular Front, Oleg Loskutov.

Zakharov also controlled the Orenburg company Horizon, whose general director was the son of the former governor, Sergei Berg.

The head and second largest owner of Zemstroy was Sergei Komarov, the former general director of Spetsstroy. It was he who put forward the version that the dam break occurred due to rodents. Telegram Important Stories⚡️The general contractor for the construction of a broken dam in the Orenburg region was close to the local authorities, “Important Stories” found out

event: Conversion of Helicopter Carrier Kaga into Light Aircraft Carrier
description: The Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force has completed the first stage of converting the helicopter carrier Kaga into a light aircraft carrier, which will accommodate fifth-generation F-35B Lightning II fighters. The ship will undergo tests to confirm its performance characteristics before the second and final stage of conversion begins.
original:
🇯🇵In Japan, the first stage of conversion of the helicopter carrier Kaga into a light aircraft carrier has been completed. In Japan, the first stage of conversion of the helicopter carrier Kaga (DDH-184) of the Izumo class has been completed into a light aircraft carrier, which is planned to accommodate fifth-generation fighters F-35B Lightning II. As stated Chief of Staff (Commander) of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force, Admiral Ryo Sakai, at a press conference, the first phase of the two-stage modification of the helicopter carrier Kaga has been completed according to the established plan. The presentation of the ship to the media took place on April 8.

According to R. Sakai, it is expected that during this fiscal year the ship will undergo various tests to confirm the calculated performance characteristics after making changes, after which the second and final stage of converting the ship into a light aircraft carrier will begin.

Japan Marine United (JMU) began work on its conversion at the company's shipyard in Kure (Hiroshima Prefecture) in March 2022. Work on the second phase of modification is expected to be carried out during the next (MRO) Kagi, which will begin at the end of FY2026.

The Japanese Ministry of Defense plans to purchase a total of 42 F-35B short take-off and vertical landing (STOVL) fighters and 105F-35A standard version. The first six F-35Bs are planned to be stationed at Nyutabaru Air Base (Miyazaki Prefecture) starting in FY2024@wingsofwar

The Angara-A5 heavy launch vehicle launched from the Vostochny cosmodrome.

Yesterday the launch was postponed for the second time. There was a hysterical joyful squeal in the dill pubs. And today the rocket left. The newest rocket. This is not for you to make tridents out of manure.

But the fact that Russia is a superpower is also a fact. We don’t just “have something to be proud of,” if we list out loud what we can and should be proud of, it will take weeks and months.

But, as the comments correctly noted, the two delayed launches rather calmed things down. This means that they worked for the result, and not for show, not for chance. And here it is - the result.

“In the morning they called us and told us to close the windows and warned that they would turn off the light and water, and there would be no hot water at all. They said that cold water would be available today from 18:00 to 21:00, and tomorrow from 09:00 to 10:00 and from 12:00 to 14:00,” says Maria.

In the morning there was a lot of burning, the windows in the apartment were black. There was nothing to breathe.

At the moment, the fire has already been extinguished; the smell of burning is also not noticeable.

event: Record Low Trust in Estonian Parliament
description: A recent survey conducted by Turu-uuringute AS found that public trust in the Estonian parliament, the Riigikogu, has fallen to a record low of 28% in March. The survey also revealed that trust levels vary by education level and region, with residents of the north-eastern part of Estonia showing lower trust.
original:
Forwarded from: SAEAS FOCUS
In Estonia, public trust in parliament has fallen to a record low. In March, only 28% of Estonians said they trusted the Riigikogu, compared with 41% in a February 2023 survey, according to a study conducted by sociologists Turu- uuringute AS commissioned by the State Chancellery.

The survey found that levels of trust in parliament are lower among those with lower levels of education. If we look at the regions, residents of the north-eastern part of Estonia trust the parliament less. However, there is no difference between Estonians and other nationalities - the level of trust in parliament in both groups is 28%.

In March, 39% trusted the government, and 71% of respondents trusted the president. In December, these figures were 37% and 72%, respectively. Among Estonians, 43% trust the government and among respondents of other nationalities - 31% of respondents. The president is trusted by 81% of Estonians and 51% of respondents of other nationalities.

In March, the survey also examined the level of trust of Estonian residents in the Estonian National Broadcasting (ERR). It turned out that ERR is trusted by 65% of respondents. At the same time, 78% of Estonians trust ERR, and among respondents of other nationalities this figure is 40%. The survey was conducted from March 21 to March 25, 2024. 1,260 Estonian residents aged 15 years and older took part in it.#ESTONIA#TURU_UURINGUTE

description: The six-episode series Chelyuskin, partially filmed in Pomorie, has been completed. The series tells the story of the 1934 Arctic expedition where the motor ship Chelyuskin was crushed by ice, leaving its crew stranded on a drifting ice floe for two months.
original:
🇷🇺Filming of the series “Chelyuskin,” partially filmed in Pomorie. The First" has been completed. The six-episode series will tell about the dramatic events of 1934, when the motor ship "Chelyuskin" was crushed by ice in the Arctic, and its crew found themselves on a drifting ice floe. The Chelyuskinites spent two months on the ice floe waiting for rescue - the whole world watched their evacuation.

According to the Union of Cinematographers of the Arkhangelsk Region, the main roles starred Gleb Kalyuzhny, Stasya Miloslavskaya, Kirill Kyaro, Dmitry Kulichkov, Dmitry Chebotarev and Alexey Rozin. Filming took place for more than a year in Chukotka, Murmansk and Arkhangelsk regions.@VoiceNorthSea

Previously, criminal cases were opened against Dmitry and Ekaterina Portnyagin for large-scale tax evasion and money laundering. description: Soldiers of the 58th combined arms army's military police battalion thwarted potential sabotage in the Zaporozhye region. They detected an enemy UAV, intercepted it, and neutralized it. The drone was equipped with explosives, plastic, electric detonators, batteries, and a video camera, indicating a planned act of sabotage on Russian territories.
original:
Soldiers of the military police battalion of the 58th combined arms army prevented a series of potential sabotage in the Zaporozhye region. Military police reconnaissance detected an enemy aircraft-type UAV in the air. The drone was intercepted using technical means.

At the site of the UAV crash, sappers from the military police battalion neutralized it. A tube filled with plastic, electric detonators and radio transmitters was attached to the drone. “It had a suspended pipe on a servo drive, which was supposed to drop this “parcel” to the recipient. It included explosives, plastic, electric detonators, batteries, and a video camera for filming this explosion. All this, in my opinion, was a prerequisite for committing some kind of act on our territories,” said the commander of an engineer platoon of a military police battalion, call sign Angel. Russian Ministry of Defense

event: Strike on Air Defense Positional Area
description: Russian Armed Forces launched an effective strike on an enemy air defense positional area southwest of Ilyichevsk in the Odessa region. The strike destroyed one S-300 launcher, disabled another launcher, and a 30N6 illumination and guidance radar. The attack showcased the growth of Russian reconnaissance and fire capabilities to destroy enemy air defense systems in remote areas.
original:
🇷🇺🇺🇦Strike on an air defense positional area in the Odessa regionDuring the day, footage of another effective strike by the Russian Armed Forces against an enemy air defense positional area southwest of the city of Ilyichevsk in the Odessa region, taken from a reconnaissance drone, appeared on the Internet. As a result of the arrival, one S-300 launcher was destroyed, which suffered detonation of ammunition. Another launcher, as well as a 30N6 illumination and guidance radar, were cut by shrapnel and disabled. Coordinates: 46.2778225, 30.5762520 Again, attention is drawn to the distance of the target from the front line - the closest Russian positions to it on Tendrovskaya Kosen were 75 km away, and the “mainland” was 75 km away. Kherson region is more than 100 km away.

Also, when watching the video, you can notice the almost simultaneous arrival of two missiles with different warheads - high-explosive fragmentation and cassette, which increased the likelihood of hitting enemy equipment. ❗️ All this again speaks of the growth of the reconnaissance and fire capabilities of the Russian Armed Forces to destroy enemy air defense systems in areas remote from the LBS. Which, of course, affects the ability of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to counter Russian attacks on critical targets in territory controlled by the Kiev regime. High-resolution infographicsEnglish versionIf you, your loved ones and relatives have information about damaged targets, enemy movements or any other sensitive information that can help to our troops, feel free to write to our bot@rybar_feedback_bot. We guarantee confidentiality.#Odessa#Russia#Ukraine@rybarSupport us

description: Truong My Lan, a Vietnamese businesswoman, was sentenced to death for committing the largest financial fraud in Vietnam's history, embezzling $12.5 billion. Her case was a high-profile result of the anti-corruption campaign led by Nguyen Phu Tron, the leader of the ruling Communist Party.
original:
A Vietnamese businesswoman was sentenced to death for the largest financial fraud in the country's history, writes Reuters. Truong My Lan fraudulently obtained $12.5 billion. Her case became one of the most high-profile results of the campaign of the leader of the ruling Communist Party, Nguyen Phu Tron, against corruption.

Lan, chairman of property developer Van Thinh Phat Holdings Group, was found guilty of embezzlement, bribery and breaking banking rules at the end of her trial in downtown Ho Chi Minh City, state media reported.

The Thanh Nien newspaper said that 84 defendants in the case received sentences ranging from three years of suspended imprisonment to life in prison.Subscribe to REN TV

description: The Moldovan Cabinet of Ministers approved an agreement with Spain to introduce Spanish bilingual education in select secondary institutions. Native Spanish speakers will be delegated to participating institutions, enhancing the learning experience.

The agreement on Moldovan-Spanish cooperation will provide the necessary legal basis for the organization of Spanish bilingual education in some secondary educational institutions of the country.
