description: The water level in the Ural River in Orenburg has risen to 1,069 centimeters, exceeding the 930-centimeter danger level. Authorities predict the flooding of over 2,500 residential buildings and 2,500 household plots. Emergency measures are being taken to mitigate the disaster.
original:
The water level in the Ural River in Orenburg is rising, authorities predict the flooding of more than 2,500 residential buildings. The water level in the Ural River in Orenburg has increased to 1,069 centimeters, RIA Novosti reports, citing the head of the Ministry of Construction. The level of 930 centimeters is considered dangerous.

Local authorities write that due to rising water levels in the city, flooding of more than 2,500 residential buildings and 2,500 household plots is predicted.

In Orenburg, it was possible to protect all apartment buildings from water; there were no victims or victims of the flood in the city, authorities say. The head of the Ministry of Emergency Situations, Alexander Kurenkov, flew to the city.

According to the latest data, 11,972 residential buildings and 14,991 household plots were flooded in the Orenburg region. The most difficult situation is in Orsk, Orenburg, Orenburg and Ilek districts, Buzuluk and Buzuluk districts. Photo, video: Ural56.Ru, “Orenburg News” / Telegram Subscribe to Telegram Dozhdya Watch us on YouTube

event: Attack on Trypil Thermal Power Plant
description: The Russian Federation launched a Kh-69 cruise missile attack on the Trypil thermal power plant, completely destroying the facility. The missile's range of 400 km exceeds previous estimates, allowing it to bypass Ukrainian air defense and potentially target most objects in Ukraine.
original:
❗️the Russian Federation used Kh-69 missiles to attack the Trypil thermal power plant, and it is more dangerous than "Dagger" — Defense Express Kh-69 is a subsonic cruise missile for tactical aircraft, which the enemy can use with Su-34 and Su-35. During an attack on The enemy used its new Kh-69 cruise missiles at the Trypil TPP, which allowed him to completely destroy the most powerful power plant in Kyiv region. This is indicated by the found fragments of this missile, which Defense Express learned from its own sources.
At the same time, according to the received additional information, the launch range of the missiles was about 400 km. This parameter exceeds the known estimates of the X-69 range of 300 km, as the next iteration of the X-59MK2.

Why is this bad for us? First, a successful strike indicates that the missile can pass through exhausted Ukrainian air defense. Second, due to the launch of the missile from the sides of tactical aircraft, the typical sign of large-scale attacks with the takeoff of MiG-31k or Tu-95/Tu-160. ▪️Thirdly, if the production of these missiles is established, then due to the large number of carriers, their use can be mass-scale.

The good news is that the production of these missiles is not serial yet and there is no question of their stocks.

The missile's range of 400 km is sufficient to hit most objects on the territory of Ukraine, and if we take into account the possibility of launching from the territory of the Republic of Belarus, then the west of Ukraine is also not protected from these missiles (see the last picture).https://t.me /operativnoZSU

description: The State Duma has introduced changes to marriage registration rules to prevent fictitious marriages between Russians and foreigners. The waiting period for a temporary residence permit will increase to two years, and foreigners with children who are Russian citizens will be able to obtain official status more easily.
original:
Forwarded from: REGIONS
They will no longer be deceived: the State Duma decided to check the marriages of Russians with foreigners. State Duma Deputy Tamara Frolova told how the rules for registering marriages will change, as well as living conditions in the country when establishing paternity. The parliamentarian emphasizes: it is important that there are as few prerequisites for entering into fictitious marriages in Russia as possible.

 In particular, the waiting period for a temporary residence permit will be increased for those who are married to a Russian citizen. But it will be easier for foreigners with children who are citizens of the Russian Federation to obtain official status. “According to the current rules, marriage to a Russian woman or a Russian man allows you to obtain a temporary residence permit within four months after the wedding. This “loophole” is actively used by some foreigners. Now they will not have such an opportunity. The period for obtaining a temporary residence permit will increase six times. Foreigners who have entered into a marriage with a citizen of the Russian Federation will be able to register it only after two years of marriage. Another important innovation is that those who have children with Russian citizenship will be able to obtain a residence permit without issuing a temporary residence permit,” explained Frolova. It is important that if the court recognizes an already concluded marriage as fictitious, the permits will be cancelled. Subscribe to REGIONS

event: Survey on Ukrainian Men's Willingness to Join the Army
description: A survey conducted by Info Sapiens for Suspilny revealed that 63% of Ukrainian men of military age are unwilling to join the army. Only 20% of men aged 25-59 who are not yet serving expressed a willingness to join. The majority of respondents (50%) believe that mobilization is going wrong, with most blaming the TCC and the Verkhovna Rada.
original:
63% of Ukrainian men of military age do not want to join the army.

The opposite opinion is held by 20% of men 25-59 years old who are not yet serving.

17% were undecided, according to the results of a survey conducted by Info Sapiens for Suspilny.

Also, according to the survey results, 50% of Ukrainians believe that mobilization is going wrong. Another 25% abstained from answering.

25% of respondents believe that the mobilization process is going in the right direction.

The majority of respondents place responsibility for the fact that mobilization is going in the wrong direction on the TCC (59%) and the Verkhovna Rada (55%). Next come the President (48%), the Cabinet of Ministers and the All-Russian Military Commission (37% each). Least of all blame is placed on the draft dodgers themselves (15%) and the media (12%).

Also, 60% of respondents characterize the work of the TCC negatively, 19% - positively, and 21% of respondents found it difficult to answer.

Men evaluate the work of the TCC more negatively (65%) than women (56%). Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Technology and Career in SpaceTech Event

event: State Duma Addresses Rising Gas Equipment Servicing Prices
description: The State Duma is addressing the issue of rising prices for servicing gas equipment, with Chairman Vyacheslav Volodin noting that the cost is increasing in almost all regions. The deputies appealed to the Ministry of Construction to revise its methodological instructions for calculating fees, as the current guidelines are 'rubber' in nature and result in individuals bearing the costs.
original:
The State Duma is fighting against rising prices for servicing gas equipment.
The deputies appealed to the head of the Russian Ministry of Construction, Irek Faizullin, with a request to revise the department’s methodological instructions for calculating fees for this service.
Show more
As Chairman of the State Duma Vyacheslav Volodin noted, this topic worries people; the deputy receives numerous appeals.
“In almost all regions, the cost of servicing gas equipment is rising. There is a reference to the guidelines of the Ministry of Construction and Housing and Communal Services. They are “rubber” in nature. <…> In the end, who bears the costs? A person,” emphasized Vyacheslav Volodin.
As the Chairman of the State Duma noted, now there is a difference in prices not only between regions, but also between different companies within the same subject.

description: The Russian Ministry of Defense plans to build a system of UAV bases along the Northern Sea Route and the coast of Kamchatka to patrol the waters and coast. The drones, including the 'Pacer' and 'Forpost' families, will monitor sea and air space, detect violators, and participate in search and rescue operations.
original:
The waters of the Northern Sea Route and the coast of Kamchatka will be patrolled by drones; for this purpose, a system of UAV bases will be built there. This was reported by Izvestia’s source in the Ministry of Defense.

We are talking about large aircraft-type drones - the “Pacer” and “Forpost” families. The task of the drones will be to control sea and air space, search for violators, and participate in search and rescue operations. “We must have all the information on the location of foreign ships and warships in our economic zone in the Arctic and especially those passing along the Northern Sea Route without our permission,” - emphasized the ex-commander of the Pacific Fleet, Admiral Sergei Avakyants. In recent years, the military department has been paying significant attention to protecting the northeastern borders and strengthening the defense of Kamchatka. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Ukrainian soldiers are courageously holding their defense against the invaders, motivated by their desire to protect their country, people, and ancestors. Their motivation is key to their survival and the success of their operations.
original:
Forwarded from: Serhiy Naev
The war continues, but our defenders are giving a powerful rebuff to the invaders. The courage of the fighters who heroically hold the defense is off the charts.

I admire the strength of Ukrainian soldiers. The one who is more motivated to win, relatively speaking – the one who has a stronger desire to win, will win. For soldiers who take part in military operations, motivation saves their lives, as well as that of their comrades.

It is motivation that fills our struggle with meaning. War for the sake of war is a road to nowhere. A war for the sake of the values of one's own people, country, and ancestors is noble and just.

A vivid example of this is the volunteers who independently joined the army with the beginning of a large-scale invasion. They did not have any military experience, but their civilian qualifications and unconventional thinking became a major advantage and a devastating weapon.

The desire to expel the aggressor from their native land as soon as possible, to return to their families and favorite things - this is the main motivation of the Ukrainian military.

Together we will win! @SerhiyNaiev

description: On the night of April 11, 2024, Ukraine's Air Force, mobile fire groups, and electronic warfare units repelled a combined Russian air attack, destroying 57 aerial targets, including 16 cruise missiles, 39 attack UAVs, and 2 guided air missiles.
original:
Forwarded from: Air Force Commander Mykola Oleschuk
57 AIR TARGETS DESTROYED: 18 MISSILES AND 39 ATTACK UAVs. On the night of April 11, 2024, the Russian occupiers launched a combined strike with various types of missiles and attack UAVs. The main direction is Lviv region.

In total, the enemy used 82 means of air attack: 20 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95 MS strategic aviation aircraft (launch area - Saratov Region - Russia); 6 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles from MiG fighters -31K (launch area - Tambov Region - Russia); 12 S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles (launches from Belgorod Region - Russia); 40 Shahed-131/136 type UAVs (from Primorsko-Akhtarsk regions - Russia ., Chauda - Crimea). 4 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from the airspace of the occupied Zaporizhzhya region). Fighter aircraft and anti-aircraft missile forces of the Air Force, mobile fire groups and electronic warfare units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine were involved in repelling the enemy's air attack.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 57 aerial targets were destroyed: 16 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 39 Shahed-131/136-type attack UAVs; 2 Kh-59 guided air missiles.

Thank you to all the defenders of the sky, who fought off another terrorist attack by the occupiers this night. Together - to victory!

description: The Freedom House report for 2024 ranked Georgia as a 'transitional government/hybrid regime' with 34 points out of 100, citing 'gross political polarization' and issues with judicial independence and corruption. The report's findings are seen as biased, as they often target countries that diverge from US and EU opinions.
original: ​​⚡️🇬🇪⚡️The authoritative American human rights organization Freedom House, in its report for 2024, as a year ago, noted that Georgia has not changed its position in the Democracy Index. One should not be surprised here, in light of the latest events regarding the initiation by the ruling Georgian Dream party of the law “on foreign agents” and a number of statements regarding the protection of family values ​​other than LGBT communities...❗️So, “experts” note that with With 34 points out of 100 possible, Georgia remains in the group of states with “transitional governments/hybrid regimes.” And of course, American analysts have not forgotten about Serbia and Hungary, which have 43 points each. Georgia has the worst indicators according to the criterion of “democratic government at the federal level” - 2.25 points out of 7. The authors of the report indicate that this is to blame “gross political polarization.” In terms of “independence of the judicial system,” the country scored only 2.5 points, and in the “corruption” category - 3 points. All this suggests that the transparency of the so-called. reputable NGOs are indeed in doubt. After all, as soon as any state tries to express its opinion or move in a slightly different direction, contrary to the USA and the EU, reports and articles appear with figures in which all the institutions of the country are discredited. Very strange coincidences.

description: EU High Representative Josep Borrell emphasized the importance of continued EU support for Ukraine, stating that allowing Ukraine to fall to Russian aggression would be more costly for future generations. He highlighted that Ukraine has received 96 billion euros in support, including 31 billion euros in military aid.
original:
EU support for Ukraine must continue, since winning the war for Russia will cost much more in the future. This was stated by EU High Representative Josep Borrell, speaking at a plenary meeting of the European Parliament.

In particular, he noted that Ukraine has already received from the European Union and member countries “a fairly large amount”—96 billion euros. Of this, 31 billion, according to the diplomat, is military support. “Some may say: “Oh, it’s very expensive to support Ukraine.” Not supporting Ukraine and allowing it to fall to Russian aggression will be much more costly for us and for future generations, because Russia will become a greater threat to our security and freedom. Its (Ukraine’s, editor’s note) independence, its sovereignty, its territorial integrity are also part of our ability to continue to live in freedom,” emphasized Josep Borrell.@yigal_levin

description: Russian researchers are creating an analogue of human bone using polylactide, a biodegradable polymer with a complex microporous structure. This innovative material grows into bone tissue faster and has a size and shape similar to real bone tissue, reducing the need for multiple surgical interventions.
original:
Forwarded from: Russia News
Know ours: in Russia they will create an analogue of human bone. The basis of the innovative development is polylactide, which is a biodegradable polymer with a complex microporous structure, thanks to which the material grows into the bone faster. This is also facilitated by the size and shape of the material, which are practically indistinguishable from real bone tissue. When a significant area of bone is removed from a patient during therapy, autologous tissue taken from the patient himself is used to replace it. However, it has limited dimensions, so several surgical interventions are required, which are associated with risks, notes Yuri Novosad, senior researcher at the Laboratory of Experimental Traumatology and Orthopedics. Thanks to the national project “Science and Universities,” a specialized explosive installation was installed in the NMRC laboratory, in which all research is carried out mechanical characteristics of new materials...Read more on our website

event: Terrorist Attack at Oktyabrskaya Metro Station
description: On April 11, 2011, a homemade bomb exploded at the Oktyabrskaya metro station in Minsk, killing 15 people and injuring around 200 during rush hour. The incident was captured by CCTV cameras.
original:
Forwarded from: Sputnik Belarus
13 years ago, the most terrible terrorist attack in the history of modern Belarus occurred, 15 people were killed and about 200 were injured. On April 11, 2011, an explosion occurred at the Oktyabrskaya metro station in the center of Minsk in the evening during rush hour. A homemade bomb was hidden under one of the benches. Footage of the tragedy was recorded by CCTV cameras.

On the anniversary of the terrorist attack, @SPUTNIKBY recalls what happened - the rescue of survivors, prompt investigation and punishment of those responsible.

event: Consideration of Draft Law on Mobilization
description: Ukraine's parliament has begun considering a draft law on mobilization in its second reading, which is demanded by both the military and Ukraine's partners. The law aims to increase the mobilization resource of the Armed Forces and is seen as a message to partners that Ukraine is ready to win back its territory and needs weapons for mobilized personnel.
original:
❗️The adoption of the draft law on mobilization is a message to our partners that we are ready to win back our territory and we need weapons, - member of the National Security Committee, Oleksandr Fedienko. The parliament has begun consideration of the draft law on mobilization in the second reading, the adoption of which is demanded by both our military and partners of Ukraine. It is needed to ensure and increase the mobilization resource of the Armed Forces.

The committee worked on the document for about two months and tried to take into account all socially significant amendments. It is very important that this draft law introduces the exchange between digital registers to fill the "Oberig" register with information. According to forecasts, in about six months, the recruitment centers will see every conscript in our country.

Also, the adoption of this draft law will be a message to our partners that we are not stopping, we are ready to win back our territory and we need weapons for those who are mobilized, - said the politician. 📲Details

description: A Russian prisoner of war shared his story of being captured by Ukrainian forces. He was part of a 'meat' assault on a Ukrainian settlement, but after his group was defeated, he took refuge in a dilapidated store where he encountered Ukrainian soldiers. Despite being enemies, the Ukrainians treated him humanely, providing him with warmth and tea, and eventually, he will be part of a prisoner exchange.
original:
😱The Ukrainian military is again provoking propagandists: another Russian prisoner of war told the story of being captured, which may shock Russians who are not accustomed to humanity. Our hero was thrown by the commanders into a classic “meat” assault on a Ukrainian settlement. After his group was defeated, he had to take refuge in a dilapidated store, in which military personnel unknown to him were hiding. Only after dragging his wounded colleagues into the building and catching his breath did he realize that the unknown soldiers were Ukrainians.

The occupier was lucky. In the heat of battle, the Ukrainians got their bearings and realized that it was a replenishment of the exchange fund, and not an attacking attack aircraft, that had arrived at them. Thanks to this, the occupiers remained alive and are waiting to return home as part of the exchange of prisoners of war.

We understand that after so many years of brainwashing and deliberate brutalization, it is already difficult to believe in a simple human attitude towards other people. Actually, our narrator himself was surprised that he was not only not killed, but also “warmed up and given tea.” But: Ukrainians know the value of human life, and they are fighting, among other things, so that the cannibalistic regime does not spread to them country.🎥Watch the full video on the channel of the Ukrainian military personnel of the Yakovlev brothers: https://cutt.ly/Zw4SQm4b📱Chat bot “I want to live”t.me/spasisebyabot☎️Calls to +38 044 350 89 17 and 688 (from Ukrainian numbers )⌨️Write to Telegram or WhatsApp

description: A thriving industry has emerged in Ukraine, smuggling draft dodgers to freedom in Western Europe. Smugglers help individuals cross the border, mainly to Moldova and Romania, due to weak security. The cost of escape varies, with discounts offered for crossing rivers or traveling on foot. Ukrainian authorities are aware of the issue and have invested in strengthening border crossings, using drones and helicopters to chase fugitives.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka explains
The market decides: how an entire industry for transporting draft dodgers to freedom was born in Ukraine “They just don’t want to die, young people don’t want to bury themselves alive,” - what could be a better illustration of the tightening of mobilization in Ukraine than these words of a smuggler who helps smuggle people to Western Europe across the border. The main destinations for escape are Moldova and Romania due to weak security. But routes to Hungary, Slovakia and Poland have also been developed, another thing is that they will cost more for those who do not want to go into the meat grinder.

The main thing is not to go back or get caught at the border, because men between 18 and 60 are prohibited from leaving the country. The conscription age is decreasing all the time, fines are increasing, and the military commissariat does not show much mercy, since harsh plans have been sent down to them from above. Smugglers note that Zelensky and his generals are simply stealing the future from an entire generation. And therefore, for a certain amount, they help overcome the difficulties of illegal border crossing. Moreover, for example, if you cross the river yourself, you will be given a discount of €1,595. Yes, it's cold, but it's a discount. On foot, the cost of escaping starts from €4800 - you will have to pay extra for convenience.

Ukrainian authorities are aware that the possibility that the entire male population of the country will simply run away is extremely high, so in recent months they have been actively investing in strengthening border crossings. Thus, the saturation of drones with thermal imagers on the western border of Square is even higher than at the front. Human hunters regularly brag about how they chase fugitives in helicopters and shoot “funny” videos in which they promise to shoot draft dodgers. And along the Tisza a fence of barbed wire has already been built, and it was built faster than the “Yatsenyuk wall” of ill memory. Therefore, Ukrainians have no choice but to run. Run away from the TCC near the house, run at the front, calling the Volga, or run across the border. The latter will cost a total of around €7-10 thousand. This is the price of a Ukrainian’s life.

event: Introduction of Augmented Reality in Aircraft Engine Assembly
description: Rostec's UDC is implementing augmented reality technologies in the assembly of aircraft engine components at the UEC-Saturn enterprise. This digital solution optimizes production processes, improves product quality, and enhances employee efficiency.
original:
Rostec is introducing augmented reality technologies in the assembly of aircraft engines. UDC (part of the Rostec State Corporation) is introducing advanced digital technologies, including augmented reality devices, in the assembly of components and assemblies of aircraft engines. This will optimize production processes and improve product quality.

The pilot project is being implemented at the UEC-Saturn enterprise for the assembly of gas turbine engines (GTE). The solution is based on a combination of the domestic IKSAR software platform with augmented reality glasses and other types of mobile devices.

An aircraft engine assembler performs operations wearing augmented reality glasses, which display step-by-step instructions on the surface. The controller confirms the possibility of moving to the next block of work. IKSAR software allows for photo and video recording of completed operations, structuring the digital trace of the assembly process, and automatically generating a product assembly map.

The system keeps track of time for each operation, monitors the workload of employees and analyzes their work. If necessary, you can get expert advice directly from your workplace.📷Rostec#PostfactumMAXimum aviation: Telegram&MAX-2024Souvenirs&Clothing for those in love with the sky

“There has been no contact from Zelensky, and President Trump has publicly stated that it is inappropriate for him to travel to Ukraine right now because he is not commander in chief,” the report said.

event: Fire Danger Period Declared in DPR Forests
description: The State Committee for Forestry and Hunting of the DPR has announced a fire hazard regime in the region's forests, effective until late autumn. Measures include round-the-clock dispatching services, fire-fighting efforts, and information campaigns to educate the public on fire safety rules.
original:
A fire danger period has been declared in the forests of the DPR. What is possible and what is not?

The State Committee for Forestry and Hunting of the DPR announced the start of a fire hazard regime in the forests of the region; it will last until late autumn. Chairman of the State Committee Alexey Shebalkov reported this to DAN today.
 
“We have introduced a fire danger period in our forestry areas. All our forces and forestry assets have been put on full combat readiness. In particular, round-the-clock operation of dispatching services of subordinate activities has been established, fire-fighting measures are being carried out: creating mineralized firebreaks, clearing forest roads for the passage of specialized equipment, raids by foresters, information work with the population, etc.,” Shebalkov noted.
 
As part of information work, booklets with fire safety rules are distributed to vacationers in the forest, lectures are given to children on this topic in schools, and appropriate posters are hung in forest areas. Shebalkov added that fires for barbecues can be lit in forests, but only in specially equipped places. But for a fire in an unequipped place there is a fine.
 
In total, about 90 people will be involved in fire-fighting activities at the initial stage. In extreme heat, forestry operations will be completely closed to people and control over forests will be strengthened.
 
It was previously reported that about 300 hectares of new forest will be planted on the territory of the DPR this year to replace the plantings destroyed by the war.

description: The working group on SVO submitted a report to the President, proposing measures to support special operation participants and their families, as well as recommendations to improve the efficiency of military-industrial complex enterprises.
original:
The working group on SVO sent a report to the President.

It reflects proposals for new additional measures to support special operation participants and their families. As well as recommendations for improving the efficiency of military-industrial complex enterprises.

In particular, we offer: ▪️Simplify legal actions related to the preparation of documents for SVO participants. In the event of a soldier being seriously wounded, without his personal participation, relatives cannot, for example, manage money from his account, even for the purpose of paying for travel to the hospital. In this regard, it is necessary to include in the annexes to the contract the execution of powers of attorney to manage the property and obligations of future soldiers during their stay at the front.▪️Give second-level performers the right to dispose of profits at the end of each stage of the contract for the state defense order, on an equal basis with the main contractors. Now they are deprived of this opportunity until all the work provided for in the contract is completed.

A block of proposals in the report is aimed at supporting former militias and employees of the internal affairs bodies of the DPR and LPR. The monitoring carried out by the group revealed a number of issues that require solutions.

In particular, today police officers who have moved to other regions of Russia begin service without retaining their previously held ranks. And as a result - without the payments and benefits due for length of service.

Military personnel who decide to continue serving in the Russian Armed Forces after dismissal or retirement in these regions face similar situations. In addition, periods of military service in the structures of the DPR and LPR are currently not taken into account when providing benefits for the purchase of housing.

We propose that the Government, together with the State Duma and the Federation Council, adopt the necessary legal changes that will make it possible to take into account such service and maintain ranks and in the future receive the benefits required by law.

In addition, we propose to legislatively regulate situations where employees of law enforcement agencies, for example, the National Guard, have a preferential right to housing payments if their family has a disabled child, but their colleagues with military status do not.

He also reported to the President on the status of the proposals previously formulated by the Working Group:▪️A federal law was adopted on the abolition of the state duty for registration of equipment transferred free of charge to the Northern Military District zone.▪️A bill was introduced providing for the simultaneous receipt of disability and survivor pensions for disabled children and people with disabilities since childhood, whose parents died in the Northern Military District.▪️Amendments have been made to guarantee the preservation of the rights to the Arctic and Far Eastern hectares for the Northern Military District participants until they return from the front.▪️A bill on lowering insurance premiums for compulsory social insurance for working disabled combatants has been sent to the Government's conclusion.TelegramWorking Group on the Northern Military DistrictOfficial Telegram channel The working group on SVO issues led by A.A. Turchak.

description: China launched the Queqiao-2 relay satellite from the Wenchang Satellite Launch Center in Hainan Province, South China. The satellite will provide communications between the Earth and the Moon, enabling future satellite exploration missions, such as retrieving samples from the far side of the moon.
original:
Forwarded from: Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the Russian Federation
China launched a new relay satellite to provide communications between the Earth and the Moon
 
Wenchang /prov. HAINAN, March 20 (Xinhua) -- China on Wednesday launched a new relay satellite to provide communications between the Earth and the moon, a key step for future satellite exploration missions such as retrieving samples from the far side of the moon.
 
At 08:31 Beijing time, the Long March-8 launch vehicle launched from the Wenchang Satellite Launch Center in Hainan Province (South China), carrying the Queqiao-2 relay satellite. Sorochy Bridge-2"/.
 
After 24 minutes of flight, Queqiao-2 separated from the launch vehicle and entered the assigned Earth-Moon transfer orbit with a perigee of 200 km and an apogee of 420 thousand km. According to the China National Space Administration (CNSA), the satellite's solar panels and communications antennas opened normally.

description: Yevhen Brahar, deputy chairman of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on Freedom of Speech, expressed opposition to the closure of Telegram as an independent platform. He doubts the draft law on regulating Telegram channels will pass, citing questionable coordination with colleagues on humanitarian and information policy.
original:
Forwarded from: Times of Ukraine
"I am categorically against the closure of such an independent platform as Telegram," said Yevhen Brahar, deputy chairman of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on Freedom of Speech.

"Servant of the People" told the Times of Ukraine journalists that the draft law on regulating the work of tg channels will most likely not pass through them. Coordination with colleagues dealing with humanitarian and information policy is questionable. And he hopes that in the session hall the people's deputies will not support the initiative of Mykola Knyazhytskyi, the people's deputy from "EU". In particular, he proposes to disclose the ownership structure and sources of public funding upon request.

As a reminder, the platform has already received a list of dubious propaganda tapes that should be blocked, and the review is currently underway. Times of Ukraine

description: Over the past 10 years, Crimea has seen significant improvements in education. 163 kindergartens were built, eliminating queues for preschool education. The Crimean Film Media Center was also renovated, attracting Russian film companies and aiming to revive interest in domestic films.
original: 🏫What changes in the field of education have occurred in Crimea over 10 years? 163 kindergartens were built on the territory of the republic. Before the reunification of Crimea with Russia, children under 3 years old did not receive preschool education. Now there are no queues for kindergartens. Also, during this time, 7 new schools appeared in the republic, 2 of them were reconstructed, one was overhauled, and another 13 will be put into operation by 2027. The Crimean Film Media Center was completely reconstructed in the republic. The main task is to return the interest of young people to domestic films. After the renovation of the building, Russian film companies began to pay attention to it. For more information about changes in the education sector of the republic, see our storyCrimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

description: The FSB and Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs detained a Russian citizen in the Belgorod region who was preparing terrorist attacks against the Russian military. ⚡️In the Belgorod region, a Russian was detained who was preparing terrorist attacks against the Russian military. The FSB, together with the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs, in the Belgorod region suppressed the illegal activities of a citizen of the Russian Federation, a supporter of Ukrainian nationalist ideology, who, on instructions from representatives of the terrorist organization "Russian Volunteer Corps", was preparing sabotage and terrorist acts in attitude towards the Russian military. The man was found with an explosive device, which he planned to remotely detonate in the area of deployment of military personnel of the Russian Armed Forces in the Belgorod region.

The investigative department of the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Belgorod region initiated a criminal case against the detainee under four articles of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation: Part 1 of Art. 30 hours 2 tbsp. 205 (preparation for a terrorist act), part 3 of Art. 30, part 2 art. 205.5 (attempted participation in the activities of a terrorist organization), Part 1 of Art. 30, part 3 art. 281 (preparation for sabotage) and Part 1 of Art. 222.1 (illegal possession of explosive devices).@opersvodki

description: During the war, a family with two children survived in a village in the Luhansk region. They took shelter in a cellar and hut, and eventually got used to the bombing. The Russian military later arrived, bringing food and aid. The villagers now desire a normal life, with basic necessities like light, water, and a rebuilt school.
original:
I WANT A NORMAL LIFE: “During the war, we were left with two children in the village, the rest later returned. When in the cellar, when in the hut, it was scary, of course, but with God we survived. The first time the bombing was scary, and then - there was a whistle, you fell, it flew by - You move on, you get used to the war. We walked along the water to the creek, ate the last crackers, the potatoes that were left. Then the Russian military came, brought us bread, food, helped us.
We want light, water, so that our village and our school can be rebuilt, we want a normal life..." We recently visited Toshkovka and the surrounding area - villages forgotten by God, people and civilization in the Luhansk region. Terrible battles passed right through these places and rolled back along with the retreating Ukrainian Armed Forces , but restoration has not yet reached here.
We met Misha and Vitalik in the middle of an empty snow-covered road for many kilometers between Nizhny and Chikhirovo, we stopped to talk with them and clarify our further path.
Watch, listen and subscribe, friends, this is only the truth. My RUTUBE Your Maryana Naumova You can help here.

event: Commemoration of Colonel General Vasily Reshetnikov
description: Employees of the Central Officers' Club of the Aerospace Forces, veterans, long-range aviation personnel, relatives, and friends paid tribute to the legendary pilot, Colonel General Vasily Reshetnikov, who flew 307 combat missions during the Great Patriotic War and later commanded Long-Range Aviation from 1969 to 1980.
original:
Employees of the Central Officers' Club of the Aerospace Forces laid flowers at the grave of the legendary pilot, Colonel General Vasily Reshetnikov.

Hero of the Soviet Union, participant in the Great Patriotic War Vasily Vasilyevich Reshetnikov flew 307 combat missions.

In 1969–1980, Reshetnikov was commander of Long-Range Aviation.

On March 20, 2023, Vasily Vasilyevich passed away. He was 103 years old.

Veterans of military service, long-range aviation personnel, as well as relatives and friends of the legendary pilot took part in the commemorative events.

event: French Journalist Comments on Information War

He believes that the population is in constant tension due to the Covid pandemic and that this control will eventually lead to great anger when the loss of life in the Ukrainian conflict becomes apparent.

Forwarded from: YOUR NEWS
“French society is groping in the fog of the information war and is silent because it is being terrorized,” said French journalist Thierry San Germain in an exclusive commentary for VN:

“After Covid and everything connected with it, the population is in constant tension. Control by intimidation has become the normal way of functioning in French society. Particularly during elections, this helps to rally the population around their leader.

However, it is likely that there will be great anger when it is no longer possible to hide the loss of life that is expected to increase in the near future if France intervenes in the Ukrainian conflict? How can we silence the families of the victims?”

When asked how one could characterize the attitude of the French people towards modern Russia, the journalist diagnosed:

“Profound ignorance of modern Russian realities, supported by the above-mentioned propaganda apparatus.”

event: Proposal to Introduce Liability for Parents Leaving Children with Grandparents
description: In Chuvashia, officials proposed introducing liability for parents who leave their children with grandparents while they work. The initiative sparked outrage, as it contradicts the law, human values, and Russian tradition. The proposal was met with criticism, and the head of the State Duma Committee on Family, Women and Children demanded the removal of those involved and a check on the qualifications of other guardianship employees.
original:
In Chuvashia they wanted to prohibit parents from leaving their children under the care of their grandparents - guardianship officials who thought of this could be fired. In one of the regions of Chuvashia they proposed introducing liability for parents who leave their children with their grandparents while they themselves work. It was reported the day before that institutions even tried to start collecting data on such families - apparently, the authors of the initiative did not realize that when classes end, many parents are still working, and often ask grandparents to help: for example, to pick up a child after an after-school program. As a result, the innovation caused popular outrage, and now the initiative has reached the head of the State Duma Committee on Family, Women and Children, Nina Ostanina.

The deputy wrote an appeal to the head of Chuvashia demanding that all those involved be removed from work, and at the same time check the qualifications of other employees of the guardianship authorities. The new ban contradicts not only the law, but also simple human values, as well as Russian tradition, in which a large, friendly family with mutual assistance is the norm. Moreover, in conditions where both parents work to maintain a high standard of living, the attempt of deputies to interfere in family affairs seems absurd. Most likely, the initiative will be withdrawn, because it could have a negative impact on demographics: some families maintain a high standard of living thanks to the help of grandparents, who share with them the responsibility of raising children.

"Readovka"

description: Farmers in Boryspil, Brovarsky, and Obukhiv districts of Kyiv region have started sowing spring agricultural crops. As of now, 2.19 thousand hectares have been sown, including cereals and legumes. The region plans to use 1148.5 thousand hectares for the 2024 harvest, with 541.4 thousand ha allocated for grain crops.
original:
Sowing of spring agricultural crops started in Kyiv region Farmers of Boryspil, Brovarsky and Obukhiv districts were among the first to start sowing spring agricultural crops in Kyiv region.

Lina Shchurevych, head of the Department of Agro-Industrial Development of the Kyiv Regional State Administration, informed about this during the briefing. 🚜To date, 2.19 thousand hectares have been sown in the region, including: cereals and legumes - 1.67 thousand hectares.
 
According to the forecasted structure of cultivated areas of agricultural crops for all categories of farms in the Kyiv region, it is planned to use 1148.5 thousand hectares for the 2024 harvest, which is 10.9 thousand hectares more than last year.

It is planned to use 541.4 thousand ha for grain crops, which is 47.1% of the structure of the sown areas. Including, only 177.1 thousand hectares of winter crops have already been sown for grain‼️🚨9425.03 hectares of agricultural land need to be examined for the presence of areas contaminated by mines and explosive remnants of war. See more details👉

description: Vladimir Putin addressed citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections, thanking voters for their participation and support. He emphasized the significance of the election, which chose the path for Russia's future, and acknowledged the work of election commissions.
original:
🎙V.V. Putinak’s address to citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections (March 21, 2024)💬Today the official voting results for the Russian Presidential elections have been summed up. An extremely important election campaign for our country, society and citizens has ended.

<...>

The past campaign was intense and extremely responsible, because by and large we were choosing the path that Russia would take next, choosing the future for ourselves and our children. And the significance of this event was understood by the absolute majority of voters who came to the elections.

Once again, I thank everyone who took part in the voting, regardless of who you voted for. The main thing is that you have proven that you respect your civic duty, value freedom of choice and your voice, and each of your votes, I repeat, was of great importance.

<...>

Thank you for your support. For me this is more important than a formal victory in the elections. This is support for the political and economic course of our country, our common results, which, of course, should be greater, but are already making Russia even stronger and more independent today.

A few words about the work of election commissions at all levels. As always, you acted clearly, competently, on the principles of transparency and in strict accordance with the law, and in our historical territories, members of election commissions were an example for voters, showing courage and courage. I thank you all for your trust. I will do everything in my power to justify him. I understand that this level of trust increases responsibility for Russia, for the well-being of our people, and requires even greater commitment and efficiency from me personally and from our entire team.

We will do everything to ensure that the large-scale national projects and programs that I recently spoke about in detail in the Address are implemented. The elections showed that Russia today is one big, friendly family. We are walking together along the historical path we have chosen. Confident in themselves, in their abilities and their future. Read in full#Elections2024

event: Battle for Moschun and Kyiv Region
description: The battles for Moschun, Gostomel, Irpin, and other cities and villages in the Kyiv region determined the fate of Ukraine and its capital. The Ukrainian people showcased their strength, unity, bravery, and efficiency, while exposing the evil and hatred behind the Russian flag.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Today we remember a battle that can never be forgotten. It was in the battles for Moschun and nearby, in the battles for Gostomel, for Irpin, for other cities and villages of the Kyiv region that the fate of Ukraine and the Ukrainian capital was determined.

Then it was not only possible to prevent the Russian army from entering Kyiv. Then it became obvious to everyone in the world what Ukrainians are like and what Putin's Russia is. Who in the world did not believe in Ukraine at that time - and, unfortunately, there were many of them then - they all saw the strength of our people, the unity of our people, the bravery and extraordinary efficiency of the soldiers of Ukraine. And who in the world still, unfortunately, believed in Russia - they all saw what evil comes from Moscow, what hatred hides behind the Russian flag.

Everything changed then, in February - March 2022, precisely in such battles, in such manifestations of the heroism of our people and the baseness of our enemy.

description: Josep Borrell, the head of European diplomacy, stated that the EU would not 'die for Donbass', implying a reluctance to intervene in the conflict. Cotret emphasized that Russia has not attacked any European country, making EU interference unnecessary.

They are trying to give back: a member of the Bundestag suggested why the EU will not die for Ukraine.

Earlier, the head of European diplomacy, Josep Borrell, said that the EU would not “die for Donbass” and called “not to scare people.”

Steffen Cotret explained to Izvestia that most likely Borrell “wants to correct something” with his statement. The politician pointed to militant voices in France and Germany who want to send ground troops to Ukraine. At the same time, he emphasized that Russia did not attack any European country. “Therefore, there is no reason for a European country to interfere. I would wait and see how the European Union behaves further,” he concluded. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Training of Attack FPV Drone Operators
description: Instructors from the Central Military District's Unmanned Aerial Vehicles Training Center in the Sverdlovsk region have trained over 100 attack FPV drone operators since the beginning of 2024. The comprehensive training covers engineering, tactics, programming, and repair, as well as practical flights and crew interaction.
original:
Central Military District instructors have trained more than 100 operators of attack FPV drones since the beginning of 2024
Instructors from the Center for Training Unmanned Aerial Vehicles of the Central Military District, stationed in the Sverdlovsk region, prepared for units performing combat
Show more
tasks in the Northeast Military District zone, more than 100 operators of attack FPV drones since the beginning of 2024.
Students master a new military specialty in a comprehensive manner: they study the basics of engineering training and tactics for using FPV drones, UAV programming and repair.
In addition, during practical flights, cadets hone interaction as part of crews, in which the first number controls the drone, the second prepares projectiles, ensures signal quality, and also assists in search, target selection and guidance.
As part of the course, more than 50% of the training time is devoted to practicing the technique of piloting high-speed drones on a simulator and practical flights on the training track. Military personnel improve their accuracy in hitting “enemy” targets by overcoming specialized obstacles of different sizes.
#The Truth is Behind Us #We Don’t Abandon Our Own

description: The Amur Shipyard, part of USC, will begin providing partial compensation for food costs for main production workers in the factory canteen from April 1. Compensation will be made at actual costs, up to 100 rubles per day, for dishes from the main menu. The program aims to support workers, increase motivation, and improve the microclimate in the team.
original: Partial compensation for the cost of food for main production workers in the factory canteen will begin at the Amur Shipyard (part of USC) from April 1. According to the “Regulations on the provision of partial compensation for food for main production workers (OPR)”, compensation for food will be made at actual costs, but no more 100 rubles per day. It applies only to dishes from the main menu of the canteen. To activate the compensation payment to an employee of the main production, you need to attach a factory pass to the desktop pass reader and pay the full cost of lunch. Partial compensation for actual costs will be accrued to the employee in the month following the reporting month. Let us remind you , that the issue of subsidies for food was raised at a meeting of the workforce by the General Director of JSC "USC" A. Puchkov during his working visit to the ASZ in February of this year. A significant amount of time was then devoted to social and everyday problems, the solution of which was prioritized by the plant management. The program for compensating part of the cost of food is one of the ways to support workers and increase their motivation to work, and will also help improve the microclimate in the team of Amur shipbuilders and health factory workers

event: Meeting of Russian Ministry of Defense
description: Russian Minister of Defense, Sergei Shoigu, held a working meeting with military leaders and enterprise directors to discuss the progress of artillery ammunition production. The meeting highlighted significant improvements, including a 22-fold increase in component production and a 2.5-fold increase in overall production volume.
original:
Following the results of the work, the Russian Minister of Defense held a working meeting with the participation of the leadership of the Russian Ministry of Defense, representatives of the relevant military control bodies and general directors of enterprises.
The head of the Russian military department noted that serious changes had occurred at the enterprises after the previous inspection.
“If we talk about the production of artillery ammunition, the production of components for this ammunition has increased almost 22 times, 75% of the components are restored, which allows us to maintain a sufficient level of supply of shells to the special military operation zone. That is, the tasks that we set a year ago have been completed. New workshops have been built, and they are working at full capacity,” said Sergei Shoigu.
Army General Sergei Shoigu emphasized that previously tasks had been set to expand production capacities by enterprises.
“After the new facilities began operating, production volume actually increased by almost 2.5 times,” noted the head of the Russian military department.
The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation noted that due to the commissioning of new facilities, enterprises are working ahead of production schedule.
“We were counting on an increase in production volumes in the third quarter, but we actually achieved this at the end of the first quarter. And a huge amount of work has been done, the enterprise has not just been reconstructed and modernized, it is a new enterprise in many components,” the head of the Russian military department emphasized.

description: Ukraine's military-political leadership prioritizes holding positions at any cost to maintain morale and popular support, despite criticism from the West. This tactic aims to prevent defeatist sentiments and show that the front has not collapsed.
original:
A question of faith. What determines the logic of Ukraine’s actions on the battlefield now?

In yesterday's report from The New York Times from Rabotino, attention was drawn to the comment of ex-adviser to the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Sak, who explained why Ukrainian troops do not even abandon unfavorable positions, but continue to stubbornly fight for them, despite criticism of this tactic from the West.

Sack noted that “this is important for morale, popular support, internal belief in our potential to win. At some point, the symbolic becomes strategic.”

In fact, this has been discussed before. But perhaps for the first time, the concept that symbolic-political factors for the Ukrainian authorities and command are no less (and perhaps more) important than military-strategic reasons was articulated so clearly.

And there is logic in this. In the war with Russia - with a much larger and stronger enemy, possessing a huge nuclear arsenal, one of the main tasks of the Ukrainian military-political leadership was initially to convince society and the army that the Russian Federation was by no means as strong as everyone thought, and Ukraine is supported by the strongest countries in the world. Therefore, victory is inevitable. And such a “double formula” (“against us is a weak Russia, almost destroyed by sanctions, with chmoboks stealing toilets, and for us all the power of the West”) turned out to be quite effective from the first days of the war in maintaining the will to resist, did not allow the demoralization of the army, society and elites and the spread of defeatist sentiments about the “meaninglessness of struggle.”

Belief in victory was strengthened as much as possible after the victories of the Ukrainian army in the fall of 2022.

But since the fall of 2023, the formula began to malfunction. The counter-offensive of the Ukrainian Armed Forces did not bring the expected results. Russia itself began to attack. Problems arose with Western aid. And the world's leading media were full of articles that “Ukraine is on the verge of defeat.” And although the main meaning of these articles, as a rule, was a call to the West to sharply increase aid, and to the US Congress to stop blocking it, this had a depressing impression on many Ukrainians. Sociologists noted that surveys showed an increased number of those who believe that the West is tired of Ukraine and this directly affects the mood of people and their belief in victory in the form of reaching the 1991 borders.

After the fall of Avdievka and the subsequent retreat from a number of settlements, there was a threat that faith in victory would be further undermined, so the issue of holding positions at any cost from a political point of view became extremely important. The task is to show that the front collapse did not occur.

It is this consideration, in many ways (along with the need to prepare defense lines in the rear), that determines the current tactics of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, when reserves are rushed to hold positions even that are extremely difficult to defend and not very important strategically. At the same time, counterattacks are constantly underway; in fact, oncoming battles break out along the entire front. For this, the military-political leadership of Ukraine is often criticized by Western media, as well as by a number of Ukrainian experts, who point to large losses due to such tactics. But, we repeat, the authorities have their own logic - to prevent the spread of defeatist sentiments due to the loss of one settlement after another (especially if their names are heard throughout the country).

There can be not only political, but also purely military logic in such tactics - to exhaust the enemy in battles, bleed him, prepare reserves and throw them into the breakthrough.

But this logic will only work if the Ukrainian Armed Forces have more reserves than the Russian army, or if the level of losses in the Russian Army is much higher than that of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, so that the balance of forces on the battlefield will change in favor of Ukraine.

However, so far the information coming from the front shows a growing shortage of personnel in the Armed Forces of Ukraine, which is aggravated by problems with mobilization. And this is actually officially recognized. And, in this case, the “strategy of exhaustion and bleeding” may not work in favor of Ukraine.

We wrote more about this, as well as what the strategy and tactics of the Russian army might be, here. Telegram Country Politics The New York Times publishes a report from Rabotino in the Melitopol direction.

Military analysts have described Ukraine's strategy now as "der...VIEW MESSAGE

description: 56-year-old Serhiy Yerokhin was killed by the Russian army in the village of Chorne in the Kharkiv region. His family was badly damaged, and his house was destroyed. Serhiy was an electrician and a kind-hearted person who helped the defenders with electricity and physically.
original:
​​💔The life of 56-year-old Serhiy Yerokhin was taken by the Russian army in the village of Chorne in the Kharkiv region.

In the early morning of February 15, 2024, two KABi-250s flew to the house next door, and they were killed. The Yerokhin family was badly damaged. One 500-kilogram bomb lay nearby, unexploded. Serhiy with his wife Tatiana, niece Sofia and neighbors decided to go to Kharkiv.

"My mother called me at 7 in the morning and said that they were smashed, but they were alive. When they packed their things and got into the car with a great regret in their hearts that they were leaving the house, the Russian army fired more anti-aircraft missiles. One bomb hit our house, the other - into the car. Neighbors were waiting in their cars, their wounded were taken away by an ambulance, but my relatives were not," said Yulia, Serhiy and Tatiana's daughter.

The bodies of Tetyana, Serhiy and their niece Sofia lay on the street for more than 12 hours while relatives organized funeral services and took them to the morgue.

"Representatives of the local authorities did not offer or provide us with any financial assistance. And we had three homes. All savings were burned down. Sofya comes from a large family, without a father, how is that?" Yuliya asked.

Her father, Serhiy Yerokhin, comes from the village of Kurganne (formerly Pioner) in the Kupyan district. He majored in electromechanics, then entered the Kharkiv National Technical University of Agriculture. He served three years in the army and navy.

"My parents loved each other very much. Dad sent my mom flowers and gifts. Mom flew to Khabarovsk, where he was serving. When dad came on vacation for a month, on April 9, 1988, they got married. By their own strength, as they say, by blood and then - they earned property. And in 1990, I appeared, their only and most beloved daughter," Yuliya said.

Serhiy worked as an electrician in a collective farm, then at an oil extraction plant in the village of Prykolotne. Last year he returned to work in Chornoy, in agriculture, because the plant was closed due to losses due to the Russian occupation. Began to breed an apiary. I wanted to travel.

"Father was the soul of the company, a humorist, an honest person. He loved life. He knew neither vacations nor days off - he always ran to help everyone who needed it. Friends from the whole district knew that Mykhailovych had the best homemade wine: grape, raspberry, apple, cherry," said the daughter.

The village of Chorne, where the family lived, is located near the border with Russia. From the first days of the full-scale war, it came under occupation.

"My parents survived for more than half a year. There was a shortage of food and household items, lack of money, moral oppression. In the end, they waited for the Armed Forces. Dad helped the defenders with electricity and physically. He knew how to instill hope that they are not alone, that victory is ours. In my parents had a cow and all the defenders knew where there was delicious milk, cheese, sour cream... I am sure that my parents paid for their love for the Motherland, for supporting the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As unfortunate as it may sound, there were many collaborators. Most of them fled to Russia. They were afraid , that the SBU will punish them. Some stayed in the village and did not suffer punishment... I am at a loss for words to describe my despair, and also to thank my parents for everything. Now there is no mother and father, no home, nothing. Even old photos flew with them... I'm waiting for the parents to call and say: "Daughter, everything is fine," Yulia added.

Serhiy Yerokhin is survived by his parents, daughter, son-in-law, granddaughter, sister, nephews. Ukrainian Truth together with the Memorial platform honor the memory of civilian victims of the war

description: Ukrainian Pravda presents the leaders of the project 'UP 100. original:
​​"Ukrainian Pravda" presents the leaders of the project "UP 100. The power of women" 🇺🇦War has a female face.

These are the faces of women who joined the army or became volunteers in the first days of the full-scale invasion.

Which move science and education, culture and business in the most difficult period of the existence of the Ukrainian state.

Who are waiting for their children, loved ones from the front or from captivity.

Who lost their dearest.

Who, despite the daily pain of losses, learn to live anew.

A Ukrainian woman today is about how, overcoming pain and fear, to look for meaning where it is sometimes impossible to find it, to rise and move on.

In order for the female face of war to one day become the female face of victory.

We celebrate a hundred Ukrainian women who bring victory closer with daily work, self-sacrifice and concern for the next generations of Ukrainians.

Learn more about each of the leaders - follow the link🔻 to subscribe

original:
❗️Where have the containers for separate waste collection disappeared in Simferopol?

Many people noticed that in the capital of Crimea, more than a month ago, problems appeared with the separate collection and removal of garbage.

“Currently, the State Unitary Enterprise of the Republic of Kazakhstan “Krymekoresursy” is working to collect containers intended for receiving recyclable materials located on the territory of the urban district of Simferopol due to their inadequate sanitary condition. description: In China, air taxis, specifically the EHang model, are being sold on marketplaces for 2.39 million yuan (approximately 31 million rubles). The first batch sold out quickly, indicating high demand. This development paves the way for advancements in technology, infrastructure, and regulatory frameworks.
original:
While skeptics say that “it won’t take off,” in China they are already selling copters - air taxis directly on marketplaces. The model from EHang costs 2.39 million yuan (about 31 million rubles).

The first batch was sold out in a matter of hours.

This is, of course, far from the most optimal design scheme, with a lot of shortcomings, but the rush demand helps pave the way for the development of technology and infrastructure. Including the regulatory administrative component, which is boring and usually not particularly interesting to ordinary people.

So the transport revolution continues, and we sit and grumble on the sidelines. To then hysterically catch up and overcome...

Yes, from the experience of similar publications, I have come across the fact that people do not see the difference between such an aircraft and a helicopter. Fruit is fruit, screw is screw, tit is tit. To put it as simply as possible, the limitations in the widespread use of helicopters are a complex and expensive mechanical transmission, swashplate, and a lightweight but expensive gas turbine engine. Therefore, usually the price tag for a turntable, even a light one, is from a million dollars and above, with the exception of ICE Robinson. Based on this, their market is limited to thousands per year.

The same toy, with similar parameters, has a much lower cost, several times or even an order of magnitude higher motor life and operating cost, simpler electronics control, which makes it easy to make both unmanned and manned versions. Moreover, the training program for pilots is greatly simplified.

And plus multi-rotor and tiltrotor designs make it possible to develop a helicopter version, which is much more economically profitable than helicopters in terms of energy (fuel) consumption. All together, this leads to the fact that the market volume will easily surpass tens of thousands of products per year, and will significantly exceed the helicopter market, occupying the gap between helicopters and cars. And these numbers can easily be googled in order to assess the potential of the market that is being created, and which we are flying past, having starting competencies in no way inferior to the leaders. Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

Forwarded from: Moscow News
🗺In Moscow, the first official tram network diagrams began to be placed at stops. In February, they were already installed at 12 metro stations, next to which there is a transfer to a tram. By the end of the year, the schemes will appear at all tram stops.

description: During a Russian Navy Baltic Fleet exercise, a missile mistakenly hit the fishing trawler Kapitan Lobanov, resulting in the sinking of the ship and the deaths of three crew members. Four more were injured, and two are still missing. The incident was initially covered up by the authorities of the Kaliningrad region, who reported only a fire on board and one death.
original: 🎪🚢Russia (accidentally) sank its own ship during an exercise. The fishing trawler Kapitan Lobanov, where three crew members were killed on March 19, sank after it was mistakenly hit by a missile during a Russian Navy Baltic Fleet exercise. Four more were injured. The authorities of the Kaliningrad region hid this, officially reporting only about a fire on board the trawler and allegedly one death. Two people are still missing after the incident.

description: Russian authorities expelled Spanish journalist Javier Colas, who wrote the book 'Putinistan', after 12 years of working in Russia. He was given 24 hours to leave the country, with threats of problems if he didn't comply. This follows a previous warning from police to stop covering the actions of wives of mobilized Russians.
original:
An El Mundo correspondent who wrote the book “Putinistan” was expelled from Russia. According to the publication, on the evening of March 19, journalist Javier Colas received a request from a certain Russian official to leave the country within 24 hours.

“If you don’t leave before your visa expires, you will have problems,” Kolas was told. El Mundo did not explain what led to the decision not to renew the journalist’s visa. The next day, Javier Colas left Russia.

The editors said that several months ago police came to Kolas’s apartment in Moscow and warned him to stop covering the actions of the wives of mobilized Russians.

About his expulsion from Russia, Kolas himself said the following: “It’s hard to suddenly cram 12 years of your life into three suitcases in one night and close the door, knowing that the next day this apartment will become forbidden territory for you.”

———

Javier Colas worked in Russia for 12 years. He also covered the events on Maidan in Kyiv, and then traveled to Crimea and Donbass. He met the beginning of a full-scale war in Kyiv, from where he wrote reports about the first days of the Russian invasion for the Spanish media.

In February 2024, Kolas published the book “Putinistan”, dedicated to modern Russia. In it, he calls the war “a crusade to destroy Ukraine, which did not fit into Putin’s project.”

———

Photo from the account of Javier Colas on the social network X.

event: Criminal Investigation Against Former Head of Forensic Medical Examination Department
description: A criminal investigation has been completed against the former head of the forensic medical examination department in Primorsky Territory, who received bribes for prioritizing services. The accused received bribes from funeral agencies for expedited judicial research and body releases, totaling over 550,000 rubles from 2018 to 2023.
original:
Forwarded from: Investigative Committee
In the Primorsky Territory, a criminal investigation has been completed against the former head of the forensic medical examination department, who received bribes for “out-of-turn service.” The investigative authorities of the RF Investigative Committee for the Primorsky Territory have charged the former head of the forensic medical examination department of corpses of the Vladivostok city department of the State Budgetary Institution of Health Care with accepting bribes. PC BUREAU SME" T. Yakimova. She is accused of committing crimes under paragraph “c” of Part 5 of Art. 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, part 2 of Art. 290, part 2 art. 290, paragraph “c”, part 5, art. 290, part 1 art. 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (taking a bribe).

From 2018 to 2023, the accused received bribes from representatives of funeral agencies for the priority conduct of judicial research and the release of bodies to relatives for burial, including on weekends and holidays. The bribe amounts ranged from 5 to 12 thousand rubles. In total, 5 episodes of committing a crime were established during this time. The funds were transferred both personally and transferred to the bank account of the intermediary - the daughter of the accused. The total amount of bribes amounted to over 550 thousand rubles.

Currently, the investigative actions in the criminal case have been completed, in the near future the accused and her defense attorney will be given the opportunity to familiarize themselves with the materials of the criminal case. The criminal case was initiated based on the materials and with the operational support of employees of the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Primorsky Territory. Subscribe to Sledkom

description: The Security Service of Ukraine detained a 19-year-old university student who was recruited by the FSB to spy on SBU employees and coordinate strikes on Zaporizhzhia. The agent gathered intel on defense factories, including their operations and cargo movement, to facilitate targeted missile and drone strikes. However, the SBU exposed the plot and detained the agent before any attacks could be carried out.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a traitor who spied on employees of the Security Service and coordinated strikes on Zaporizhzhia.

It was established that, on the order of the FSB of the Russian Federation, the suspect spied on local employees of the SBU in order to establish spare points of deployment of the Service.

According to available information, in the future the enemy planned to use this information to prepare missile strikes.

In addition, the attacker tried to establish the exact coordinates of enterprises that are involved in the defense-industrial complex of Ukraine.

For this purpose, it received approximate geolocations of defense factories from the occupiers, and then carried out reconnaissance in the area near them.

During surveillance, the figure recorded a maximum of information about the objects: from their mode of operation to the intensity of movement of cargo equipment in the open area of the workshops.

She also used her friends and group mates "in the dark" from whom she asked the information she needed during friendly conversations.

Under her guidance, the invaders hoped to launch targeted missile and drone strikes on production enterprises.

However, the Security Service prematurely exposed the criminal intentions of the aggressor and detained the Russian agent at the stage of intelligence gathering.

According to the investigation, the enemy accomplice was a 19-year-old student of a local university, who came into the field of view of the FSB in the fall of 2023.

Subsequently, the girl was recruited remotely through her godmother - a collaborator who is part of the leadership of the occupation administration of the Russian Federation in one of the temporarily captured towns in Zaporozhye.

It was through her that the Russian special service gave instructions to the recruited agent in the regional center and received "reports" on the completed tasks.

Currently, the detainee has been notified of suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 28, Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

She is in custody. She faces life in prison.

description: Radia, a US-based company, is developing the world's largest cargo aircraft, WindRunner, to transport large wind turbine blades. The plane will have a unique ability to land on short runways and a massive cargo hold, 12 times larger than the Boeing 747-400. It will use existing, FAA-approved technologies to accelerate wind energy development and contribute to the transition to clean energy sources.
original:
#Aviation@mpre_view1 #USA
Just drawings, but since February 22nd this niche has been free and there are only two manufacturers left in the world who can build this. And it's not us, our Dream is dead.
___________________
Show more
WindRunner, the world's largest cargo plane, is made in the USA
The American company Radia, based in Colorado, is working on creating the world's largest cargo aircraft, called the WindRunner. The main goal of the project is to solve the problem of transporting large blades for wind turbines, CNN reports.
A unique feature of the WindRunner will be not only its impressive payload and hold capacity, but also its ability to land on relatively short runways of only 1,800 meters in length, including dirt and gravel. According to CNN, no other cargo aircraft in the world has such capabilities.
The WindRunner's cargo hold will be 12 times larger than the cargo version of the wide-body Boeing 747-400, allowing it to accommodate three Olympic-size swimming pools. The aircraft's wingspan will be an impressive 79.5 meters. Despite the innovative scope of the project, Radia representatives emphasize that the WindRunner will use existing and proven aircraft technologies, materials and components approved by the US Federal Aviation Administration.
WindRunner is designed to solve the logistics problem in the fast-growing wind energy industry. Thanks to its unique characteristics, this aircraft will be able to deliver large wind turbine blades to hard-to-reach areas where the construction of full-fledged airports is not economically feasible. This, in turn, will accelerate the development of wind energy and contribute to the transition to clean energy sources.
Industry experts are eagerly awaiting the arrival of WindRunner and believe that this project has the potential to revolutionize air cargo transportation and provide a powerful boost to the development of renewable energy not only in the United States, but throughout the world.

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces launched a deliberate attack on civilian areas in Belgorod, targeting high-rise buildings and the Belgorod Arena stadium. The attack was carried out using unguided 122-mm shells, causing terror and destruction. The Ukrainian propaganda machine is attempting to justify the attack by spreading false information.
original:
Fake: The Ukrainian Armed Forces attacked Russian military facilities in Belgorod, Ukrainian telegram channels report. Truth: The strike was deliberately inflicted on elderly areas, as evidenced by photos and videos. The footage that Ukrainian propaganda boasts about en masse confirms that the target was precisely civilians, as has been the case many times before. The consequences of the attack on high-rise buildings and the Belgorod Arena stadium are being replicated online without hesitation.

At the same time, TsIPsO are trying to justify the Ukrainian Armed Forces in order to hide a targeted attack on the civilian population. Channels working for Kyiv launched a fake story that the infrastructure in Belgorod was allegedly damaged as a result of the operation of air defense systems. First of all, disinformation is revealed by the absence of traces of shrapnel remaining on buildings after being hit by an air defense missile.

Judging by the consequences of today's terrorist action, the Ukrainian Armed Forces opened chaotic fire on the city with unguided 122-mm shells at the limit of their range. In this case, there is no talk of any high-precision strikes on military targets. The purpose of such attacks is terror, which has already become the calling card of the Ukrainian army. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

The document was generally accepted in this form. They also provide the option for military personnel to be on treatment for 12 months without having to undergo an IVC every 4 months.
